case.state: Thank you Mari! The red stands for… something I think, but it’s an important part of the shrine maiden uniform! And I don’t mind if it catches someone’s attention.
You know, it was a pain to find this place. Oh, I’m Reimu Hakurei, the Shrine Maiden of Paradise. I’m sure at least some of you will be worth getting to know!
I’m Hakurei Reimu, Gensokyo’s freewheeling shrine maiden. I need a break after all the hard work I’m always put through, so the rest of you had better be nice to me!
Urk! Why is— ~Player~, find someone else, quick, before she opens her mouth!
Urk! Hold on ~player~, I dunno if we want to invite this lady to the table. Look at her legs, her hair. Her boobs! She blows me out of the water, pick someone I compare favorably to.
Oh, where did she come from? Say, ~player~, do you want to try moving to another table? This one is bad now.
Gensokyo. I’ve never heard of Inazuma, but if it’s like where I’m from it has rowdy youkai and shrine maidens with the power to silence them.
The game’s starting? Wait, I— Ugh, why are you here, Miko? I’m trying to meet someone that isn’t already married, you philanderer.

I’m Reimu Hakurei, the Shrine Maaaaaaaah! No, don’t start now—
Ugh, hello Miko. Go away. I’m trying to meet people who are both single and not you.
Wait, I told Yukari to bring me to the outside world club called The Inventory— so why am I at the Scarlet Devil Mansion? Why is Remi here? I’ll exterminate that old hag!
I can’t stay too long, I’ll need to get back to the shrine. It’s Setsubun, and I can charge people to throw beans at Suika.
Sigh… Hey Sakuya, if you’re going to stay here, could you at least fetch me some tea or something?
I’m a Shinto shrine maiden for the Hakurei Shrine, Fischl. My job is to communicate with the gods and exterminate youkai. It’s a lot of work, you know.
Taking off all my clothes at an onsen kind of removes the allure of the game. Like, I do that often enough anyway.
Wow, an open-air bar! This is bigger than any of the food stands I normally eat at, it’s like a party! Okay, first one who loses who isn’t me has to buy drinks for everyone!
Is that the sea? Gensokyo is landlocked and closed off from the outside world, so I’ve only been to the beaches on the moon! I should have brought my swimgear.
Wow, it’s so romantic up here! This is perfect, anyone who sees me in this soft moonlight will fall for me before they can even blink. Wife city, here I come!
I’d hate to be outside in weather like this… but it’s so warm and cozy in here. It’s like the whole house is under the kotatsu! You’d better not turn down the fire once the clothes come off.
Eh, is this the Scarlet Devil Mansion? I was hoping to go to the place called the Inventory… though, these people seem interested in love too. Yeah, this should work just fine!
A library seems like an odd place to do this. Aren’t you supposed to be quiet in places like that? Though the only library I know is at the Scarlet Devil Mansion, and it’s always noisy there.

I expected a more romantic location. This alley is pretty dirty, and doesn’t seem very private… Wait, did ~player~ get locked out of the bar and is pretending ~human.ifMale(he|she)~ meant to go out here?
Easy mode? Disgusting.

Don’t worry, I know what I’m getting into. I have to protect my reputation in Gensokyo, but there’s no need to care what any of you think— unless you’re particularly eligible ~human.ifMale(bachelors|bachelorettes)~!
It’s just one thing after another when you’re Gensokyo’s number one incident resolver! I’m here to relax and hopefully meet someone special, so try not to get on my nerves.
Checks if the Player is a gay male or a straight female.
All of them! I don’t care, anything’s better than this!
This hand is awful!
Ughhhh. To hell with the whole lot.
Nope, nothing for me!
I’m good! I’m gonna win for sure!
Naturally, I don’t need anything.
I know ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~ will do the trick!
Hmmm… ~cards.text~? Does that feel like it will work?
~Cards.text~ will work! I’m sure of it!
Do I look like I have a clue here?
Dealer, ~cards.text~ new ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~— for a cute girl!
~Cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~. Exactly ~cards.text~.
I think if I read it, my poker book would say to swap ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
~Cards.text~. Please.
Give me something better than these ~cards.text~!
Hmm, hmm… ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.
Don’t care!
It’s the luck of the draw anyway, right? Well, give me ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~.

Can I have ~cards.text~ ~cards.ifplural(cards|card)~?
{small}Is that a lot?
The plum trees by the Hakurei Shrine are blooming really nice this year! I’ll have a lot of plums to make plum wine with!
Does anyone here like sake? I can’t get enough of the stuff! Ask me anything about sake!
If I wanted to, I could communicate with the god of these cards. I wouldn’t though, I don’t need such parlor tricks to secure a win.
I wish I snuck some sake from home here. Not for now of course, but for after the game.
Do you think any of the other shrines or temples could pull off a miracle like this hand? Not on your life!
Winning is more fun than losing, even if it’s all meaningless in a game like this! Though, I’d probably be saying something different if my cards were lousy.
You can’t con anyone out of money in this version of poker, so there’s no reason to hide how good your hand is, right? Too bad.
Heh, and Kasen said that being overconfident would be my downfall. Yeah, right.
I’ve got divine protection, but that mostly just extends to battles with gods or youkai. Any poker victories are entirely skill.
I’m pretty well feared by all the local fairies. That’s why they always come over to the shrine to play. They want to curry favor with me because I’m so terrifying.
It makes my job easier if the youkai already know to fear me. That’s why I’m always rude when solving incidents, and sometimes don’t offer them the first cup of sake at parties.
I knew bullying Tewi the lucky rabbit wouldn’t have any negative consequences!
When I get back, maybe I should treat the three fairies behind the shrine to some dango. They have been somewhat well-behaved recently.
Victory is what builds faith. People are wishy-washy, though, so I always have to succeed to keep them believing in me. Not that it matters in this sort of game.
There’s no one in Heaven or Hell who can stop me! At least that I’ve fought. And I’ve fought plenty.
I finally managed to kick this freeloading Inchling princess out of my shrine. She was so small and weak she needed to be protected, but now she’s recovered her magic. So… that’s good.
Hakurei Shrine’s cherry blossom viewing parties combine some of my favorite things, like the beauty of nature, sake, and visitors to the shrine.
Playing strip poker to find a spouse seems way easier than dating. Man, I’m a genius or something.
I didn’t think about what cards to swap that time, but it worked!
The universe shall provide… which is good, since I have no idea what I’m doing.
Trying to figure out this game is too much effort after all. I’m glad I didn’t bother!
Even my mentor Kasen couldn’t lecture me with cards like these! Don’t tell her I’m here.
I wouldn’t mind a mid-match tea break. I deserve a chance to relax!
If this game wraps at a reasonable time, I could take my new beloved to the Geidontei pub for some drinks! …You’d be paying.
If we get married, it’d be nice to go to a private hot springs. Imagine, just the two of us… and some sake, of course.
What sort of meal would be good for our wedding dinner? I’d prefer something Japanese over Western, but I definitely want to eat meat!
I admit I like to get myself off as a way to de-stress after a hard day’s work. And I may just be motivated to work even harder if I had someone waiting for me!
I’ll swap… wait, I already swapped. Never mind.
I’d wonder who I should invite to my wedding when the time comes… but the usual lot will show up regardless, so who cares?
It probably won’t happen, but in case anyone does want to throw themselves at me after the game, I’ll bring you back to the shrine and cook you a warm and filling meal!
I like having time to relax in this game. It lets me just sort of feel the people here. I’m not sure how to explain it better.
I sure could go for a soak in the hot springs right about now. Maybe I’ll force Okuu to make herself useful and heat one up with her sun powers.
I remember the time Marisa almost caught me pleasuring myself in the shrine. It was embarrassing, but also a bit exhilarating. Kind of like how I feel now.
Plum wine isn’t actually the same as Western “wine” where you ferment the grapes. Rather, plums are steeped in sake. It makes a tasty drink that’s sweet and full of alcohol— just like me!
Some people call nigori “unfiltered sake”, but it’s actually just less filtered than standard sake. It’s a sweet drink served chilled, perfect for the summer months!
There are plenty of Shinto gods who love alcohol! That’s why it’s a religious experience to offer sake. After all, getting drunk is a mystical experience, exceedingly close to the divine!
Most of the oni and tengu I know like to drink sake out of wooden boxes called masu. Some of them have masu ten times normal size! I can still drink them all under, though.
During ceremonies, like weddings, sake is drunk out of saucers called sakazuki. The oni Yuugi even has a magic sakazuki that transforms any sake poured into it into the highest grade!
Oh! I can’t believe we’ve gotten this far in the game without me asking the important question! Obviously everyone here would want to marry me. Why would you make a good spouse?
We’ve been here a while, but I’m still not sure who here’d be the best to marry. So, I’ll ask it straight: what would make you a good spouse?
Hakurei Shrine should be alright while I’m gone, I left Aunn in charge. She’s my komainu. It’s like a dog, except… it’s a dog.
Hey, you should come stop by Hakurei Shrine’s plum wine festival! Contrary to what you may hear in the newspaper, I did not drink our entire stock this year.
Why are buildings all so big in the outside world? Is it because everyone’s super rich?
I can’t read minds like some youkai. Gimme a hint on how good your hands are.
Poker is a Western card game, so it’s not something I’m well versed in. I’m lucky some books on it fell in from the outside world.
Do any of you think you’ve been cursed by some youkai? I can exterminate them for you… for a donation to the Hakurei Shrine, of course!
It used to be Spell Cards were literal cards with descriptions of magical attacks. But that was too much of a hassle, so we stopped requiring that.
Suika’s an oni, meaning she’s strong enough to bench-press a mountain. But getting her to do even the most trivial work around the shrine? Impossible.
I’ve gone foraging for edible wild plants before, it’s fun… until the tabloids come out saying the Hakurei Shrine maiden is so poor she’s eating grass.
My most important job is keeping the balance of power in Gensokyo. It’d be dangerous if any single youkai faction got undue influence over the land. Therefore I beat everyone up, impartially.

I deal with “incidents” in Gensokyo, which are mysterious happenings extending over the land. I solve them by wandering around beating up the youkai I meet, until I find the mastermind and beat them up too.
The gatekeeper at the Scarlet Devil Mansion no longer tries to stop me from coming in. Not sure if it’s due to fear, negligence, or the mistress’s orders.
The Prismriver Trio sure have gotten popular recently. I listened to them when their music was unknown… and their tickets were cheap.

The new book by my favorite mystery author is coming out soon, but I’m worried some youkai is going to start an incident before I can finish reading it. Maybe I should go around fighting everybody ahead of time.

Kappa tech is supposedly soooo great… well, I wouldn’t know. You’d think those misers could at least offer me a discount, seeing as they’d never be able to peddle their wares without my shrine’s festivals.
If harvest goddess Minoriko was the god of my shrine, we’d get tons of visitors during the Fall, plus all the sweet potatoes I could eat. Ah, but she’d be useless the other three seasons.
I don’t mind visiting the Netherworld because the ghost princess there eats so many snacks her servant Youmu puts out extra for everybody.
By the way, this stick with tassels here? It’s called a gohei. It’s used for Shinto purification ceremonies, and smacking youkai in the face.

Animals are dumb. All you need to do is give them a little bit of food and attention and take them for walks and set up a nice place for them to sleep and they just glom onto you. What’s up with that?
Do I have enough green onions at home for miso soup? It’d be bad if I couldn’t properly prepare tomorrow’s breakfast.
I wonder if I can spin playing this game into a tale to impress the villagers… “I exterminated the evil cloth wrapped around them… um, donate to the Hakurei Shrine.”
Good thing no one in Gensokyo’s human village knows about this place. They already think I’m flakey, despite always trying my hardest when it matters.
I have an arrangement with Clownpiece, the fairy who lives under my shrine. As long as she doesn’t make it too hot in the summer, I won’t exterminate her.

Poverty goddess Shion is so pathetic even that idiot Tenshi’s skills amaze her, and Tenshi will eat up the praises of anyone who sings them. They’re an annoying couple, but I wouldn’t mind that level of devotion myself.
Sometimes I catch a Hell Fairy named Clownpiece napping on the porch in broad daylight. I suppose I should punish her, but… next time. I’ll do it next time.
Getting married isn’t just about the lovemaking, you know. I want someone who I can chat with as we sit outside, sipping sake.
Playing this game, I’m starting to understand what’s accurate and what’s not in those shunga erotic art books I— I found.
Everyone else here is so good looking… but I can’t just marry for looks. I want someone who can properly take care of me.
Gensokyo’s been sealed off from the outside world for a long time now… I wonder how people’s attitudes towards marriage have changed. Maybe they don’t even wait until the wedding night to “do it”!
I should make sure to stock up, there’ll be a party soon at the Hakurei Shrine. I don’t know when, or why. But we all love excuses to party.
If I bring anyone home to be my spouse, I’m sure Yukari will be her usual nosy self. Don’t let her intimidate you though, that gap hag’s just bitter since she’s an old maid.
I wonder if I could entice some people to play this game at our next party. Not until the fairies go to bed, of course, but I want to see how some of those more modern girls style themselves.
If I lose, I’ll have to do it… and everyone will be looking at me. Hm, actually thinking about it, it would annoy me more if everyone ignored me.
Touching yourself is normal, right? There wouldn’t be so many lewd art books if that wasn’t the case.
Wow, the lights on the wall and ceiling sure are bright. They don’t even flicker. People in the Outside World have gotten really good at candle-making.
Only very expensive sake is sold chilled, by the way! I’ve, uh, never had any expensive sake myself, though. But I can brew my own for you! It’ll have lots of love, and also a high alcohol content.
In Japanese, sake actually refers to any alcoholic beverage. What Westerners think of as sake is called nihonshu, or “Japanese wine”.

Nothing warms you up better on cold winter nights than hot sake! It also brings out the flavors, making even the cheapest sake taste wonderful!
{small}I drink a lot of the cheap stuff…
While sake has existed since the birth of Japan, most of what’s brewed outside Gensokyo uses methods developed in the last 50 years. Plenty of modern bottles fall into my shrine.

A lot of Westerners living in Gensokyo like drinking sake out of wine glasses, but I prefer ochoko, traditional small ceramic cups.
{small}Though, if I’m drunk enough, I drink straight out of the bottle… Ehehe…
I think I need to exorcise these cards.
So… who else here has won hundreds of games of poker in their life before? Ehehee…
This hand is due to magic, Eirin’s shady new drug, Yukari fooling around again, or a Moriya shrine con— Oops, I forgot templates like that were forbidden.
I-it’s never too late to pray to the gods for good fortune! But be sure to pray to the god of the Hakurei Shrine— as soon as I figure out what it is.
I wonder, could I use my ability to communicate with the gods to make money somehow? Like giving blessings or telling fortunes? …Wait, that’s just being a shrine maiden.
I hope Aunn properly guards the shrine while I’m gone. The tanuki have been putting leaves in the donation box again.
I’d order some sake from the bar, but I don’t know what sort of money they use here… and I don’t have any of any kind.
I sure hope Sumireko is okay. I overheard her telling someone she had an Outside World disease called “Ligma”.
Does anyone here have this outside world doodad, I think it’s called a “phone”? Sumireko says she can use hers to look up anything. I want to ask it how to properly play this game.
If I wanted to, I could exterminate every youkai in Gensokyo. Any time I wanted. As soon as I had the chance. If I wanted to.
What a load of— I can’t believe I actually had to pay overdue fees on that worthless How To Play Poker book.
There’s a classic Japanese phrase, “The moon sure is beautiful,” which means “I love you.” But I’ve been to the moon and it was always a pain, so I’d rather not think about it.
If these cards were being manipulated by youkai, I’d be able to feel their aura. The fact that they’re normal cards just infuriates me more.
You must be ever-vigilant against the evil youkai! They can blend in with humanity using such tactics as “taking off their hat,” or “wearing a slightly different hat.”

I don’t know of any youkai who affect people’s cards… but if you are cursed by one, come to Hakurei shrine! We’ll exterminate any youkai.
{small}Be sure to leave a donation!
Did you see what Aya put in her rag of a paper this week? Well, no, of course you wouldn’t. Good. It was all lies anyway.

The Moriya Shrine goddess Kanako is a shrewd businesswoman, and she and the other goddess Suwako are always fussing over their shrine maiden, Sanae. I wish I had a god who fussed over me… or whose name I knew.
I hate dealing with the pharmacy at Eientei. They make themselves so hard to find, and Eirin acts so smug just because she’s a genius doctor. Also their hangover medicine is too expensive.
Celestials need to learn some manners and stop exiling idiots to Gensokyo. If you don’t want Tenshi, what makes you think we do?
If that damn youkai punk rock duo wakes me up one more time, I’m going to give them a real reason to scream when I silence them!
I hope Hell doesn’t drag me into any more of their imbecilic schemes. That goddess of Hell Hecatia Lapislazuli may have three bodies, but she’s got zero brains.
People have told me to “go to Hell” before, but I hate going to Hell. Whenever I’m there, it’s a lot of work and I always have to fight someone tough.
In Gensokyo we have these two poverty goddess sisters who are always running scams. They immediately lose whatever money they make, which is maddening since they make more than me.
Is there a god of poker I can commune with? I suppose I should know all the gods, but… I don’t.
Say, does anyone know what a “doggo” is? Sumireko used it to describe Aunn, and when I asked her what it meant she said “a smol pupper.”
Hardly any people come to the Hakurei Shrine, so it’s a bit shabby. But we have the best shrine maiden around!
I hope there isn’t any sudden change in weather while I’m out. I’m not sure if Aunn knows how to set the storm shutters.
You’re lucky I’m not showing off my skills in a Spell Card duel. This game is abouuuut even for everyone.
I hope no one notices I’m gone! …Who am I kidding, no one comes to Hakurei Shrine except youkai.
Ugh, I just know my mentor Kasen is going to stop by tomorrow and lecture me for hours about every little thing she thinks I’m doing wrong… I hope she brings some sweets again.
The Buddhist temple is holding another event soon. Don’t people realize that it’s just a ploy to proselytize them? Not like the festivals for my religion.

I heard some Celestial maidens try to pick up husbands by intentionally losing their veils for men to find. If they like whoever finds their veil, they claim they can’t return to Heaven and must be wed. Kinda sad, huh?
I hope my future spouse doesn’t have a lot of stuff. My shrine doesn’t exactly have a ton of spare room.
No one here would try to card shark in a game like this, right? That would be super lame.
Hmmmmm… I was worried, but I feel as if I won’t have any trouble doing it if I lose. This game’s been exhilarating!
Before, I was nervous about everyone watching me play with myself. Now the thought excites me a bit… but still makes me nervous.
…Maybe I should spruce up the shrine a little bit. No one’s going to marry me if I have a shabby shrine.

I’ve been naked in public plenty of times in my dreams, so this is kinda familiar.
{small}I sure hope that dream world youkai hasn’t been spying on those ones.
If I can’t get a spouse from this go-around, when should I come back? I don’t want to seem desperate, but I also want to be done with the hassle of finding my soul mate.
When it comes to finding a spouse, this beats trying to make small talk with the village boys. I swear, they’re crazier than some youkai.
I still wonder if there was maybe a better way than this to find a spouse. Hmm, but every idea I can think of is even more work.
I hope I don’t get too sweaty when I— if I lose. I can wash it off later, but it would be awkward if I’m walking around with my beloved like that.
Youkai may act like they’ve got tons of experience, but can they do anything but have sex without love? Hmph, of course they can’t. As if a youkai could feel love!
Hmmm… I feel like I haven’t had any good ideas lately, so maybe it’d be best to ask one of you. I’m always trying to think up schemes to bring in the dough— what’s one you’d fall for?
Lately, I haven’t been getting the kind of draw to my shrine I need. Usually I’d come up with some get rich quick scheme, but I’m stumped! So, I’ll ask: what kind of scams would work on you?
Hey, ~player~, if you throw this hand, I’ll let you buy me snacks. Don’t you want to buy snacks for a cute girl?
Do we have to do it here? Is there anywhere else more comfortable?
Ugh… Did you really have to bring her along, Miko? I worry you’ve lived so long, you’ve outlasted your own common sense.
What’s an Ay Yu, Zoe? And wait, more important question— do I have to dress up like one of those outside world office ladies?
I already have to do danmaku battles at home in Gensokyo, I can’t help you out on top of that. And no way am I using some giant machine either, I prefer being a smaller target, thanks.
My favorite hobby is sake, Ignatz! Drinking it, brewing it, using it in religious rituals, drinking more of it! I love sake!
Is that what people in the outside world find sexy? I don’t get it, but I’ll need to step up my game if I’m going to find a partner!
Meia, this may be hard for you to believe— but I have no experience with men! Not a shred! So the rest of you tell me too!
O-oh… I’ve seduced s-so many men before, Jura. Bunches of ‘em! I don’t wanna talk all day, though, so let’s let the others chime in for now.

W-well, Jura, I’m well acquainted with, um, charming ladies. Erm…
{small}The local book renter has a crush on me, so…{!reset}
Since there’s always more to learn, I want to hear the others’ tales!

Ooh Meia, you and your crew should come visit the Hakurei Shrine! We’ll even throw a biiiiig festival for the occasion!
…You people have Earth money, right?
A kid? I-I’m not even married, Jura! And if I did get, um, get pregnant, I wouldn’t be able to safeguard Gensokyo’s balance. Or worse, drink booze!
Gensokyo is full of the sorts of things the people of the Outside World call myths, legends, and fairytales. We even have fairies themselves. I could never pick a favorite.
Would anyone pamper me if I became with child? Yukari might, just because she needs another generation of shrine maidens. …I’m sure Marisa would do as she pleases, like usual.

Is it really that easy? Us girls get together for parties often enough…
{small}Wait, is that why they’re always hanging around my shrine?
An assassin, Ignatz? That’s dangerous, I don’t want to become a young widow! Stick to something safer and more profitable, like painting.
Really, Ignatz? A valuable painting, just for me? Of course I’ll accept! Paint me however you’d like!
Ignatz, you fool, no one gets a reputation as a plum picker unless they’ve picked a few plums! So out with it! Did you get a stiffy the last time a girl took your lunch money?
I once stayed up for three days straight reading Agatha Chris-Q’s mystery novels! She’s my favorite author! Oh, but her stories are only available in Gensokyo.

Solving incidents in Gensokyo means diving headfirst into the bullets pelted at me by various youkai. Some others are fast enough to weave through the patterns, but my thing is being too scrawny to hit.

Okay, I’ve been thinking about your idea, Nami. It’s pretty sharp, except I don’t have the cash to buy even a bunch of cheap goods. And all the merchants in Gensokyo have better business sense than me.
I’ve never thought much about kids, Nami… but I got plenty of fairies to deal with. It would be nice to have someone manage the budget… well, as much as there is to manage.
I don’t think I’d like to make myself rich through piracy, Fina. We don’t have an ocean, so the closest I could get is robbing the vampire’s mansion. That’s more my friend Marisa’s thing.
You seem like you’d be a good wife, Fina. You’re caring and attentive. Too bad you already seem to have two suitors. I wouldn’t want to break something like that up.
The most dangerous place I’ve been? Probably Hell. Though some of the Hells were pretty boring too.
M-my dreams, Nami? It’s um… yeah, that’s right! It’s to exterminate all the youkai, and create a human only world!
I like how gorgeous I am! I’m every bit the traditional Japanese beauty. I also like how I can eat sweets and never get fat.
Huh? How do you know me? I don’t think I’ve seen you in Gensokyo before. Not that I’m saying you’re right about me being followed by trouble!

Are you crazy, Fina? I could never do something like this in public!
{small}I’s different here because one or more of you is almost certainly going to marry me. Otherwise I’d be a weirdo.

I’ve been to hot springs with others before, Fina. But that’s different, you’re supposed to be naked there.
{small}Though, I guess you’re supposed to be naked here too.
I’ve never heard of Moonberries, but I wonder if I could steep them in sake for a tasty drink. I do the same with some of the plums at my shrine.
Oh, um, Fina… what you need to do, is… actually, to be honest I thought someone would have whisked me away from the game to marry me by now. So if this isn’t working I have no clue.

I’m from Gensokyo, land of illusion. It’s a place hidden from the modern world, where the mundane is repelled and mysticism can still thrive.
{small}My job’s to go around and smack sense into anyone who misbehaves.
Urk! I know I’m always bugging others for donations, but somehow being offered charity here of all places just makes me feel pitiful.

Intergalactic…? Do you mean you’re from the Moon, Jim? I had to beg the gap youkai Yukari to take me. She was so smarmy the whole time, but I’ll show her how good an idea finding my Prince Charming at a strip bar is!
I’ve never really won… anything from a game. But I win all my spell card duels and resolve all the incidents, and that’s what really matters!
Beautiful girls like me can always marry up, there’s nothing shameful about that. Besides, it’d be nice to have a spouse to take care of me… I’ll still accept your money as a donation, though.
I’ve never heard of anything called a “superhero”, Critical, but it doesn’t seem odd to me. Everyone in Gensokyo has some kind of power, but I’m the only truly altruistic one.
Here’s a mood I feel often, Critical: I’m hungover, shut up you dumb youkai.
Eh, I’ve fought the Goddess of Hell and the Goddess of Makai before. It was a pain, but I still won in the end. Though the only thing I’d like them to give me is my free time back.
I don’t see what’s so good about wings, Critical. Everyone in Gensokyo can fly already, so the wings are just for show. Now the ability to gather fame and fortune… that sure would be nice to have.
If more people knew of my heroic deeds, I’m sure they’d be lining up to donate. Unfortunately, the muckraking newspaper reporters only ever seem to print bad things about me.

Youkai are meant to be exterminated or sealed, Myriam. That is the only justice they deserve, and my duty.
{small}Please write that I said that in your paper and take a picture of me looking cool like this.
Syrenne, when you said “you’ll get what you get”… do you mean all the handsomest rich guys show up on other days? I’m new to all this, but I want the best spouse possible.
Syrenne, you said you knew a good scheme to rake in dough? I’m all ears! Go ahead and take whatever cut you want, we’ll all be rich soon enough!
Dye that makes clothes invisible? I’ve never heard of anything of the sort, but wouldn’t that defeat the purpose of clothes? Unless it makes the wearer invisible too.
My pal Marisa puts a ton of time and effort into studying magic and improving herself. Thankfully, I’m naturally gifted at mysticism, which is great because I hate working hard.
Imagine bringing Marisa here… taking off her clothes… touching ourselves together… urk— I’m not imagining anything!
Oh, I’m broke all the time, Syrenne! All you have to do is come up with a get rich quick scheme, like the time I turned the shrine into Hakureiland! Wait, that was a disaster.
Those sorts of things are usually my jobs where I’m from, Syrenne… and I don’t even get paid as it is.
Fancy me? With all the people who bug me and tease me— no! Absolutely not! Just being an arse it is!
Ahhhh, a bath would be so nice after this game! I’ve been to hot springs with my friends plenty of times. Is that not common where you’re from, Syrenne?
I got plenty of drinking stories, Syrenne. Like the time we tied a balloon to our scaredy-cat friend Youmu and told her it was a ghost!
I’ve got so many drinking stories, Syrenne. My friend Sanae is infatuated with giant robots, so one time we convinced the fairies at my shrine to dress up like one!
I don’t have an end to drinking stories, Syrenne. Once, we threw this annoying girl, Tenshi, off a waterfall! …It was Tenshi, she was fine.
I got drinking stories for you, Syrenne. Like the time we bet the nuclear hell raven Okuu she couldn’t make a sun bright enough to turn night into day— actually, I don’t want this story to get out.
Opener? Like… something I say to her if I want to marry her? Wait, am I supposed to say something specific? I didn’t practice for this!
A poem, Hu Tao? I was hoping someone here would read me a love poem, but I’m guessing that’s not your style.
Listen Miku, who asked you about being a wife? I mean, I know I literally did, but I don’t think youkai have much interest in holy matrimony, so just can it.
I have no idea what an “internet” is, but I need these bloomers to wear. If I sold them, that money would have to go to buying new bloomers, so I don’t see the point.
Incompetent…? Wait, are you talking about Marisa? She may act easygoing, but she’s one of the hardest working people I know! And she’s not my sidekick, she’s my rival… who I team up with a lot.
There’s plenty of youkai in Gensokyo, and it’s no easy feat taking them down if they get serious. Thankfully, full scale incidents are pretty infrequent.
I been plenty of places that felt hellish, Nami, but the actual realms of Hell suck. Avici the Infinite Hell is boring, the Lake of Blood is gaudy, and the Hell of Blazing Fires is too hot.
Obviously, that’s the dream of every youkai exterminator, Nami. What else would we dream about? It’s not like you would know my dreams better than me.
Oh, wow, you wrote an actual lo— an actual poem. I thought you’d think up something rude! Um, sorry, it’s a nice poem.
I don’t have any pets, per se… but I do have Aunn, a mystical lion-dog protector of my shrine known as a komainu. She’s a cutie.
I get what you mean, Fluttershy. The shrine does its best business when the cherry trees around it are blooming. Too bad we can’t have that year-round— I’d make a mint!
At least I don’t live in my friend Marisa’s house. That place is full of all sorts of junk and she never cleans. If she’s not careful she’ll turn into a spider youkai herself.
I’ve tried listening to the birds around Hakurei Shrine, but it’s all “buy my grilled eel” this and “I’ll burn the world in nuclear hellfire” that. Bunch of bird brains.

I’m a girl of marriageable age, Fluttershy. I’d like someone to cuddle with and buy me sake. Is there a better place to find my destined than a seedy club?
{small}Wait, it sounds bad when I say it aloud…
Why are you lecturing me, Cynthia? I get enough of that at home. I do have a job, by the way, it just doesn’t pay well and is a pain to do.
I’d like having a responsible, hard working wife. The only thing, Cynthia, is you’d have to promise not to lecture me for being none of those traits.
I’m passionate about sake! Brewing it, drinking it, eating some shredded cabbage and chicken karaage then drinking more! It’s a spiritual sensation all its own!
Ionia? Maybe, I don’t really know how things are organized in the outside world, but according to maps I’ve seen Japan is an archipelago east of mainland Asia.
Um, yes, I heard… that Hakurei Shrine isn’t visited by youkai regularly, and that the shrine maiden there is very hard working and of marriageable age. Tell your friends!
I did the fortune telling gig before, Cynthia. It worked for a little bit, but neglecting the shrine and letting youkai wander in made people less trusting of me.
Flaws? Who cares about any of that stuff? If you asked my mentor Kasen you’d get a list three miles long, but as far as I’m concerned I’m fine just the way I am.
I would never turn down a free drink, Nagamimi— maybe you’re not all bad! As you might’ve guessed, I love sake. It’s the preference of any proper Japanese lady.
Does this job pay well, Nagamimi? I have experience as a youkai exterminator, but I don’t think I could work for you and resolve incidents in Gensokyo full time.
I’m from Genoksyo, a land that’s hidden from the outside world by a barrier. It’s full of youkai and other mystical beings. We have parties pretty often.
We have dragons in Gensokyo, but they mostly keep to themselves. It’s the vampires, oni, tengu, hermits, lunarians, gods, Buddhists, and animal realm mob bosses you need to watch out for.
My skills? I can exterminate youkai, brew sake, and run a perfect Shinto shrine. I can cook any number of Japanese staple dishes and host flower viewings to boot.
To be clear, Cagliostro, I was asking the normal people about their qualities as a partner. I don’t need an undersized megalomaniac for a wife… I see plenty of that in Gensokyo.
Would I change anything about my body, Cagliostro? Well, I would like to be even stronger. You know, without training.

Arthritis? Isn’t that the thing old grandpas get, Yuno?
…Should I ask what you were doing to wear out your wrist at such a young age?
Oh, so you also have the blessings of the gods to just, like, win every time, Yuno? Though outside of incident resolving I can’t ever seem to catch a break, so don’t expect it to work here.

Earworms? Is that some sort of youkai? Or do you mean like those songs Suika drunkenly sings?
{small}Hmmm… {i}Pettan, pettan, tsurupettan…

I’ve never heard of a youkai called an “earworm”… but if you mean those songs Suika sings when she’s drunk, I can think of a few…
{small i}We are the Japanese goblin…
The best merc is the one who rakes in the most cash, of course! But it’s dangerous work and if you die you don’t get paid. Well, best of luck!
They’re all bad, Leonie! Just let yourself naturally develop a nickname during your exploits. If you get a bad one like “The Shoddy Lancer” then that’s on you.
Oh, are you asking me for my housewife qualities, Leonie? Well, I can sow, I can clean, and I can cook you delicious meals every day! Even better, I can brew some top shelf fruit wine and sake!
Racing? Not my thing, Emi. I’m far from the fastest in Gensokyo, but I’m skinny enough to fit between narrow gaps in bullets so that’s all I need.
Not really, Kumatora, it’s all the same to me. Well… I guess there’s Marisa. We’ve known each other a long time…
Rice is the most essential staple food of them all, Kumatora. Oh, but I love to eat sweets and snacks! And sake, if that counts as a food.
If you want an easier time saying your name, then how about… Ku? That takes you down from four syllables to one!
Oh, I had the gap youkai, Yukari Yakumo, drop me off. She’s a pain to deal with, but if I want to pass through the Great Barrier around Gensokyo I don’t have many options.
Hmm, when you put it that way, I guess I could laze around more if I buckled down and trained just a biiit. Maybe I’ll get started on that tomorrow. I’ll see what I feel like.
Money isn’t everything, and I’m not auctioning myself off to the highest bidder! It’s more important to find a partner who’ll be devoted to me in my every waking moment!
W-what? I don’t think for a moment that can be accurate! I love exterminating youkai! Your hearing must’ve just been off that day!
Blame it on the youkai always invading my shrine. They’ve never cared about whether their partner was a man or woman, and before I knew it I was thinking the same way.
Wh-what? No! I didn’t know that! I didn’t need to know that, Miko! I just like how easy it is to move around in this!

I don’t… I’m not really comfortable… going around. Besides, I can always learn as I go, right?
{small}If you offer to “teach” me anything, Miko, I’m exterminating you right here.
I’m fine with my fingers, Miko. They work, and they’re cheap. And before you ask, no, I’m not about to shove random objects up my… into me.
Ehe, the idea of someone going between my legs and… licking me does turn me on more than I should admit. And I guess it’d be rude if I didn’t return the favor for my beloved partner.
You mean… putting it up my… no! I’ve never given it thought before, but no thanks! That sounds gross and painful!
Erufuda, your plan to cook fries for money… that’s called being a fry cook. That’s work. I don’t think you get the appeal behind “get rich quick” schemes.
You’re a big catch all right, Erufuda, but you seem pretty well taken care of already. Us humans can’t survive without someone to fetch groceries from the village for us.
Why wouldn’t we have men, Jura? Hm, though I suppose most of the nuisances who hang around my shrine are women. Um, I mean except for the men I definitely know how to seduce.
Date spots? Oh, definitely the Hakurei Shrine in Gensokyo! I heard that if you put an offering in the donation box, the beautiful shrine maiden will bless you with a happy marriage!
There are different types of blood? Seems like something only a vampire would care about. Wait, does Remilia hang around all the time because my blood is the tastier type!?
Yeah, my wallet’s been empty… recently. I’d love to buy more snacks, and expensive drinks, and some gourmet meat!
I work so hard, resolving incidents and exterminating youkai! And yet all anyone can talk about are my failures. They should show their appreciation with a donation!
Um, well… have you tried a shrine maiden outfit? A blue and white one might look nice on you…
I don’t know much about Western horiscopes, but my friend Marisa does. According to her predictions, you’re always destined to be super lucky but only because you’ll get killed in rare ways.
Back in Gensokyo, bystanders sometimes bet on the results of our danmaku battles of bullets. Though when I tried betting, the kappa I bet on took a dive and I lost all my dough.
Don’t think I’ve forgiven you for that incident you caused, Remi! Not that Scarlet Mist hogwash, I mean that time your dumb pet chupacabra drank all the good booze at Geidontei.
Remi, isn’t your self-proclaimed ability to control fate? That’s pretty romantic when you think about it. You could help people meet their destined soulmates…
Hey, Remi, why are you so short and scrawny? Do you not get enough vitamins by sucking blood? Or did you just not eat your veggies when growing up?
Say, Remi, vampires like you can reconstruct themselves no matter how much damage they take, right? Um, so does that mean your, uh, maidenhead reforms after you do the deed?
You’ve got so many people in your mansion, Remi. Tell me, have they ever walked in on you during an “intimate moment”? I’m talking about masturbation.
Remi, when you, uh, do it… do you prefer being the one in charge? Or would you rather be “served” by the other party? I could see you into either.
Sakuya, if you’re running back to the mansion to get Remi more wine, can’t you grab me some sake too? I know Remi keeps some in the cellar.
Hey Sakuya, why aren’t you stripping with Remi? Not that I want to see you naked! It just seems against the spirit of the game, is all.
Hey Sakuya, while we’re all here, you got any lewd stories of your mistress? I wanna hear about the side of her she doesn’t show when pretending to have charisma.
Miko, Seiga is your minion, right? Can’t you control her or something? She’s always causing trouble with her wicked hermit ways.
There are always so many salacious rumors in the tengu newspapers about Miko and various ladies. Are you okay with all that gossip, Tojiko?
Hey Miko, you’re loaded, right? Did they really bury you with that much money? Or do you have some business going behind the scenes… that I can get in on?
Miko, you’re not into men, are you? I mean romantic\ally. Even the usual gossip-mongers don’t make up those kinds of rumors about you.
Tojiko, be honest. Did Miko in life actually look like she does now? Or was she fat and greasy instead?
Miko, you chose your body, right? Why didn’t you give yourself big breasts? I know how much you like them on other women.
Considering you think you’re God’s gift to the world, Miko, I’d have thought you’d want to sire some legitimate children. Surely there’s some Taoist magic that lets two girls do that?
Say, Miko, how did you learn how, um, two women “do it”? Did you have those sort of thin books during your time as well?
Tojiko, are you really okay with Miko’s lust for orgies? Wouldn’t you be afraid one of the other girls would steal her away from you?
What? No! Listen to what other people are saying for once! I’m here to find a doting spouse to take care of me. I don’t just want hanky-panky, I want a relationship.
Sigh, I thought we were done here, Miko. I don’t care what you do, you womanizer, but I’m here for entirely pure reasons.
Unlike you, Miko, I don’t lust after every floozy with an ample chest. I don’t care so much about appearance… as long as they’re handsome. Or beautiful.
W-we’re getting to that already? Well, um, I have some thin books, with erotic art and stories. I read them… and imagine I’m part of them… and touch myself.
Ugh, this better not be a set-up to ask if I’ve ever done it while thinking of you, Miko. I, um, have thought about… some people. Not you, though.
Sanae’s real pretty, sure, but marrying into the Moriya Shrine would make it feel like my shrine lost. The Hakurei Shrine maiden has to stay neutral anyway.
It doesn’t make it less embarrassing when you say it like that, Miko! I’ve never shown this off to anyone! Except everyone at the hot springs, but that’s different!
O-of course I wouldn’t! What sort of woman do you take me for, Streaming? I’m a proud maiden of the Hakurei Shrine, thank you very much.
Streamed? Like… floating down a river? I’m not sure why people would want to watch me do that, Streaming, but considering your perverted ways I bet you’d want me to be naked when doing it!
Well… I’m not a sake snob like the Moriya Shrine goddess Kanako, but I know how to enjoy my drinks. Why, did you need some recommendations?
Regrets? Eh… nah.
I’m a shrine maiden and that’s that… not that the thought hasn’t crossed my mind after the new shrines and temples moved in. Well, I’m sure I can always run some scheme if I need extra dough.
Yes, I mind, Streaming. I’m not joining in on any perverse rituals for your followers! …But out of curiosity, what sort of, um, things are you planning with that bottle of sake?
It’s a pain is what it is, Streaming. There’s always some rowdy being stirring up an incident for meaningless, selfish reasons. And I’m the one who has to resolve all that.
S-sex? What sort of perverted question is that, Streaming? Even the self-serving tengu “reporters” have enough class not to ask!
Not just ghosts, Streaming. Youkai are the unknown that humans instinctively fear. The terrifying. The mysterious. The inexplicable. That sort of thing.
Not much red left of my outfit, Leon. Unless you mean a proper formal dress, though I can hardly image anyone running around like that!
I’ve been blessed with the power of the God of the Hakurei Shrine! I may not know what the god’s name is… or what blessings it bestows… but there’s no better shrine to rely on than mine!
Drinking sake is a ritual in itself, Leon. It’s the ancestral drink of Japan, and favored by many Shinto gods. It’s the lifeblood of Gensokyo, too!
Oh! I got so wrapped up talking about sake, I forgot about that. Um… what about you, Leon? Were you keeping a look out?
A shrine maiden is someone who calls upon the powers of the gods and exterminates youkai. I’m a particularly ruthless one at that.
Do you think I’m some sort of idiot, Fortune? I didn’t come here to buy a nightstand, I don’t even have a place to put it.

Think about it, Fortune! Normally, I’d have to waste all sorts of time finding my perfect soul mate and slowly wooing them with my charms. Here, we can skip straight to the part where they get seduced.
Youkai are the enemy of humans, Meia. It is my sacred duty to exterminate them. I don’t even invite them over to my shrine, they just show up with sake and snacks!
Men aren’t rare in Gensokyo, what are you… hm, now that I think about it, almost all my friends are women. Guess I never really noticed.

My plan is perfect, Jura. I’m sure this place is filled with lonely souls just waiting to be charmed by my beauty, All I need to do is find one who’s good looking, has a great personality, and gets along with me perfectly.
I wasn’t planning to get anything at the bar, Revy. For one, I don’t know what sort of money they use here. For two, I probably don’t have enough of it.
Don’t worry Nami, I’ve given this plenty of thought! I’m going to make sure my future spouse lets me do whatever I want, in addition to being rich, handsome, and charming.
Youkai are monsters, the enemy of humanity. My sacred duty is to exterminate them all. I definitely don’t get drunk with them and goof off with them!
Urk! I’m sure Marisa or Sanae can take care of anything that comes up. I’m only going to be gone for a short while anyway. It’s fine, it’s fine!
Touhou games… what’re you talking about? Wait, do you mean the danmaku battles we have in Gensokyo? Those aren’t games, Critical, those are serious!
Humans and youkai are eternal enemies, Yuri. Youkai attack humans. Humans fear youkai. Humans exterminate youkai. Those are our sacred duties.
What are you talking about Syrenne, I don’t want to get drunk… tonight… before the game’s over. Why, are you buying?
Inu-zuna? Well, I’m a shrine maiden at any rate. I come from Gensokyo, the land of illusion! For a small donation, my mystical powers can erase what troubles you!
That’s easy. They need to be rich, good-looking, have a good personality, are caring, attentive, hard-working, good at brewing sake, doesn’t nag me too much, devoted. You know, the basics.
Wow, you’re quite the romantic, Ignatz. Honestly, I mostly just know about this sort of stuff from the novels I read. The men in those books are all really romantic too.
I was aiming for a human wife, yes. I wasn’t really considering undertaking specifically as a charm point, but I guess it’s a career that’ll always be needed.
You’d better, Hu Tao. I’ve had more than enough of humans who are afraid of commitment.
I’m considering, I’m considering! Give me a minute, okay?

It’s not all fun and games, Fluttershy, being a shrine maiden is work! Every morning I sweep up the shrine grounds. Then I take a tea break. Afterwards I wait for donating visitors. Then I take another tea break.

Right, you’re basically the same thing as me, Barbara. Do you have trouble getting donations as well?
{small}In no small part due to all the rival religions muscling in.

What, you think I’m going to pocket everything along the way that’s not nailed down? That’s called being a thief, Fina. Like my friend Marisa, who steals junk on the off-chance it’s important to her study of magic.
What are you muttering about, Tomoko? I do live in the mountains, yes, but I also love taking long, relaxing baths!
I don’t see what the big deal is, shrine maidens can look for love same as any other girl. As for the hakama… well, I don’t know what the modern style is, but this is comfortable for me.
That’s me, Heris. If you ever feel science is leaving you empty and want to reawaken your spiritual side, Hakurei Shrine is always open for business!
I doubt you’d find Gensokyo on any maps, it was sealed off from the outside world long ago. It’s a place where creatures of myth and legend run around annoying me.
There’s too many strong idiots in Gensokyo, Lux, so we needed a system where we could battle without causing too much carnage. Mostly it’s an excuse for them to flaunt their pretty bullet patterns.
You don’t look all that spiritual yourself, Mari. I can communicate with the gods and solve whatever incidents befall Gensokyo. I work as hard as I need to!
A what where, Moon? Oh right, you’re one of those witches that turns monsters into servants. Are you saying you’ve managed to control even gods?
You might think it’s hocus-pocus, Yuno, but youkai extermination is the sacred duty of the Hakurei Clan. Plus, it brings in the donations.
To pass the time? I guess kids play games, and old folks play go and shogi. As for me, I have fun by drinking sake and blasting youkai with bullets!
It’s a lot of work, Heris. I have to sweep the shrine, drink tea, make sure the fairies aren’t playing pranks, exterminate youkai, and host parties.
Bras… those are those outside world under\garments, like a corset for just your chest? I’ve never worn one, seems uncomfortable.
I’ve never dyed my hair… but when I was younger, it might have had more of a purple tinge to it. It got darker as I grew up. Why do you ask?
Gensokyo’s not a city, though there is a human village inside. It’s a land of fantasy, sealed off from the outside world. Full of magic and youkai who need a smacking.
You say that, Barbara, but clearly you had the same idea as me. Find a place where passions run wild and let the others fall in love with your beauty.
Extermination is extermination, Yuri. I use the gods’ divine blessings and the Hakurei’s barrier powers to destroy or seal youkai. I never show mercy and never fail.
I’m always so overworked as a shrine maiden, Ringo. So I felt it was time to settle down and find a spouse to take care of me! It helps I’m such a catch myself.
It’s not anything dangerous Meia, and it’s not a physical barrier. It’s a boundary of sense. It doesn’t affect nature, but it does invite the fantastic and reject the mundane!
I am a shrine maiden, Saki, thank you very much! That’s why I always wear this outfit. I’m also a youkai exterminator, so don’t take me lightly.
Hmph, some pampered princess is going to lecture me about greed? I just want to live comfortably, like everyone else.
Are you going to lecture me about it, Kumatora? It’s nothing I haven’t heard before. We all need money to live and to buy snacks, I don’t see how what I’m doing is anything worthy of critique.
Gensokyo uses currency that’s fallen in from the outside world, so it’s a mix of yen and mon. If you ever lost a coin between your cushions, it might’ve got sent to Gensokyo.
Eh, you’re not interested in me, Leon? What’s even the point of you, then? And I could use a handsome husband with a nice government salary too!
I’m a shrine maiden! I lead rituals, bestow blessings, host festivals, exterminate youkai, and brew sake!
I want a spouse. Not some wishy-washy lover, but someone who will be loyal to me, and cherish me, and take care of me forever and ever. This seems like the easiest place to find that!
It’s hard work being a shrine maiden, ~marinette~. Not only do I have to be the spiritual leader of the human village, but it’s my sacred duty to protect my land from rampaging youkai!
Kwami? Are you sure you don’t mean Kami, the spirits that inhabit all things? I’ve met tons of spirits and gods in Gensokyo, so it’s possible.
I know I’m pretty, ~marinette~, it’s just… the humans who live in the village are too different from me, to say nothing of the youkai that loiter around my shrine.
I have more outfits than this one, ~marinette~, I’m not that poor. Though I suppose they do still follow the same basic pattern. Red and white are sacred colors, after all.
Youkai frighten humans, humans exterminate youkai. It’s an unshakeable bond we have. That’s all.
Dating takes a lot of work, though. If I find the right partner now, why would I want to subject myself to all that again?
Don’t worry Leon, if it’s love advice you need, you can ask me! I’ve read tons of romance novels, plus a few… erm, more ribald books.
I’m not sure what an “anime” is, but a girl from the outside world named Sumireko says I’m like one of those. So I guess I am? I’m certainly magical.
Maybe some shrine maidens do, Kaz, but I’m the best youkai exterminator and incident resolver in Gensokyo! And you, are you any good?
Don’t worry, Nami, I’ve put a lot of thought into this. First I’ll pay off my overdue book renter fees and buy some of the good sake. And, um… then I’ll laze around the rest of the day.
Hm… I don’t think we have, Rin. I meet plenty of girls as the shrine maiden of Gensokyo, but I very rarely travel to the world outside.
Eh, what are you saying, Leon? I’m not so hard up I need to steal! All my clothes are variations on the shrine maiden outfit anyway.
I’m not the only youkai exterminator around, but it’s hardly a squad, Kaz. The other girls think they’re my rivals and get in my way.
I’m not the only youkai exterminator around, but it’s hardly a squad, Kaz. The other girls think they’re my rivals and get in my way.
Youkai are the worst! Whether it’s stealing Spring, writing slander in the newspapers, making unlicensed trading cards with my image, or hanging around my shrine too much, they’re annoying!
Oh. We have musicians and dancers in Gensokyo, but they’re not connected to idolatry. Whenever I have performers at a shrine festival, we always get tons of visitors!
Either that or whoever put this table together had very specific interests, Mitama. Not that I can blame them, we’re both pretty cute.
I never had any sort of official training either. They just threw me off the deep end, since someone’s got to keep balance in Gensokyo.
Aren’t you a youkai yourself, Erufuda? Anything that’s not human, the mysterious and unexplainable, whatever gets on my nerves, that’s what a youkai is!
This is a custom made outfit, Erufuda. It’s much easier to move around in compared to standard shrine maiden attire.
Being the Hakurei Shrine maiden keeps you fit. By which I mean, the blessings of our god are youkai extermination, flight, and the ability to eat sweets and never get fat.
W-well, when you put it like that you make me sound selfish, Erufuda. I don’t plan to be a layabout or anything, I’ll do my share! Like cooking! Or brewing tea!
Even if I get married, I’ll still have to put some work in as the Hakurei Shrine maiden. With how good of a cook I am, it’s my spouse who should be worried.
I don’t have to resolve incidents every day, Mitama, but it sometimes feels like that. But there’s always the typical shrine maiden work, like sweeping the steps or brewing tea.
All the women in my family are shrine maidens and youkai exterminators, yeah… Though, I’m the only Hakurei around these days.
Inazuma? I’ve never heard of any place like that. I’m from Gensokyo, in Japan. It’s a mystical land hidden from the modern world.
There’s no problem being here, Jim. All I’m really doing is looking for a husband or wife. I’m just skipping the boring bits and starting with everyone falling for me while in the throes of passion.
I heard about this place the other day from a gap youkai named Yukari, and came up with the plan then and there. If a plan’s good, it comes together without you needing to think about it.

Well, obviously they need to be able to support me and my lifestyle. They need to be charming, good looking, can hold their sake, able to get along with the local fairies, and enjoy all of my cooking!
I’m a shrine maiden, Jason. That means it’s my duty to exterminate youkai and channel the gods’ blessings to humans.
Do you know me, Pit? You haven’t been spying on me from Heaven or anything, right?
I came here because it was far away from my shrine, Arueshalae. It’s not wholly against Shinto principles, but it’s nothing I want to advertise to anyone back home.
Resolving incidents is just my duty as a Hakurei Shrine maiden, that’s all. Same as all the maidens before me. Would be nice if people showed some appreciation now and then, though.
Okay, losing a couple times in a row happens, but thrice? I came here expecting to bare myself, but I never signed up to do all this work at once!
You’re kidding, right? I know I didn’t read all of that poker strategies book, and sure, I might not have the best luck off the job. But by the normal odds, I shouldn’t lose four times in a row!

Oh, I get it. You’re all cheating. You want to force the poor, virginal shrine maiden to expose herself for your own cruel amusement. The rest of you had better hope you start losing, because one more loss and I start sealing people away.

Right, I haven’t been able to figure out how you’re all cheating, so I’m just going to start exterminating everyone.
…I’m not really this bad, am I? Sigh…

Well, whatever. Might as well just submit to my fate. The gods determined I wasn’t going to win to~background.time~. So maybe this is a blessing in disguise? Someone will fall in love with me for sure when I bare it all!
Hold on, hold on, how am I the first to go? I read the first third of a poker strategy book and everything!
I can’t be first! I read through a book on card games {small}and didn’t finish it{!reset} for weeks! The overdue fees for that book weren’t cheap, either.

I read almost half of a whooole book about poker to prepare myself, but I forgot most of it so don’t get cocky.
{small}It was pretty boring, what can you do?
You— was this was a ploy to make a pure shrine maiden expose herself? I better see every last bit of the rest of you— or I’m exterminating everyone associated with this establishment!
Don’t let little old me interrupt the rest of you. I’m only going to take off something boring like my shoes anyway.
According to ReformCopyright, this line will never play. Well, saves me from having to come up with a line here. Writing is such a pain. Sigh…
They say it’s better to be lucky than good, and it’s true. Mostly because being lucky is less work.
I look more gorgeous with my ribbons, and I’d feel more naked without my sleeves. Besides, they’re a quintessential part of my look.

This is getting fun! And also… a l-little… risqué.
{small}Hoo Boy…
This is way more fun than doing boring marriage interviews or dating! The gap youkai Yukari is taking me back to Gensokyo, and I can’t wait to tell her of my conquests.
Well, a promise is a promise. All the ladies in the saucy novels I read can’t wait to bare their breasts, so…
I didn’t come here expecting to win every hand. I mean, winning and losing doesn’t matter so much in a game like this. Unless you’re losing.
Oh. Well, it’s just my holy of holies. Um… well, it’s okay to do this sort of thing with your spouse, right? Right. Let’s do this.
My job is to protect humans, but in a game like this it’s every girl for herself! But if you do need real protection, the Hakurei Shrine is always accepting visitors.
Hm… in a game like this, winning is worth far less than grabbing people’s attention. In that case, let’s forget about the small stuff.
I’ve taken off my clothes hundreds of time by myself at home, so it’s not like this is anything new to me. Just… gotta do it.
By the way, if I do choose one of you to wed me you should stay until after the game. I came over with the gap youkai Yukari, and it’d be good to introduce you.
Yep. I lost. Nothing to do now, but… to do it. Yes.
Well, whatever. There’s nothing riding on this game except a little bit of pride. Four of us will be out by the end no matter what.
Well, you know what I’ve got left to show. Don’t make me say it. But remember, if no one’s interested in marrying me I’ll be mad, and when I’m mad, youkai get exterminated!
Whatever. I didn’t come here to work. I don’t even go to work to work!
Well, I’m definitely not going to be taking off my ribbon or hair tubes. I could be anyone without those!
We’re all going to be married when this is all said and done, so there’s no shame in taking off our clothes! Wait, that isn’t how this works.
Now I’m starting to worry. Not about losing so much as I needed the gap youkai Yukari’s power to traverse the barrier. If no one here wants me, it’ll be an awkward ride back.

Oh. Oh, I gotta…
{small}It’s for finding a doting partner for me. Still beats working.
A-ah, well, there’s no reason you should let my love life trouble someone as important as you, Miko. After all, you’re so strong. And cool.
E-explorations? What’s there to explore with you, Miko? I want to meet people who aren’t already married.
Of course I’m interested in other people… that way… but a shrine maiden can’t be promiscuous like that. And I wouldn’t want to do it with someone I didn’t love anyway!
Um… there’s one of a soldier returning home to his wife… as soon as he gets through the door they… well, you know. And another with a queen and her attendant… exploring each other.
Urk— I… suppose I have thought about her… in that way. Where she settles down and gets serious, and we tie the knot. You know… fantasy.
I suppose you of all people would understand, Miko. You couldn’t marry just anyone you wanted, being the prince. Though you’d probably be satisfied with any pretty girl.
I’m not a whore, Miko! Well, it is a pain to put effort into something most people will never see… But more importantly, I’m not a whore!
My business? Oh, do you mean the Shrine? Tell your followers they’re always welcome to visit! Be sure to leave a donation or buy a charm!
W-wait, are you saying you’re communicating what’s going on here to your debased followers? Is that what “streaming” is!?

If you want flavored sake, you can steep it in all sorts of fruits. For instance, the plums at the Hakurei Shrine! Of course the quality of the sake matters too. The best is daiginjo, though I can’t afford that…
There’s no point in dwelling on stuff like that or having regrets, Streaming. My duty is to resolve incidents and exterminate youkai, and when it comes to that I’m always successful.
It’s fine, it’s fine, Streaming. Maybe tonight I’ll find a noble soul to unconditionally love and support me, even if the shine goes under.
You mean wakamezake? Not that I’ve read about it in books and dreamed about doing it with my beloved! A-and anyway, why are you the only one who gets to have a sip!?
There’s nothing fun about those people! You’ve got a spoiled vampire princess, a conniving gap hag, a woman who likes sunflowers, a shrine maiden like me but with bigger, um, congregations…
You’re so persistent! I don’t have any intention of marrying a youkai, so I’d never do anything like that with a youkai. They’re all selfish and unreliable anyway.
Yes, they’re very scary! You should fear them! And they’re not my friends, I only tolerate them coming to my parties and drinking my sake!
That won’t work, my day-to-day life is boring. It’s all just sweeping the shrine, performing rituals, and exterminating youkai.
I’m glad someone recognizes my talents, Leon. I guess you’re not too bad yourself. Just don’t stare too hard at this next part…
Wh-what are you insinuating? I am pure! But there’s nothing wrong with a shrine maiden taking someone’s hand in marriage… or enjoying a little sake now and then.
What, are you saying I can’t expect to strike gold with the first go around? But… but… dating is such a pain!

If you’ve already got some magic techniques cooked up, it shouldn’t be too hard to translate them into nonlethal spell cards. We don’t use literal cards anymore, that’s just what we call our danmaku attacks.
I suppose you could think of youkai like demons. They’re creatures born of the mysterious and unexplained. And very annoying.
What do you mean, is that all? Well, if that’s not enough for you, I’m also Gensokyo’s number one youkai exterminator and incident resolver! That means I’ve defeated countless enemies!
They look like— well to be honest, they look like cute girls. But don’t be deceived, youkai bring destruction and chaos when left unchecked! Never let your guard down!
There’s plenty of both men and women in the human village, but I was raised apart from them at the Hakurei Shrine. And the sages of Gensokyo are all old hags.
Ah, I guess that wasn’t a very good lie. Still, people generally don’t show up to my parties until after I stop whatever crazy incident they caused. It’s such a pain.

Right, I’m Hakurei Shrine’s shrine maiden. It’s my duty to protect the Great Hakurei Barrier and keep order in Gensokyo!
{small}I accept donations of all types.
What? No! I meant I’ll exterminate any youkai that are plaguing you! I’m not— I haven’t— Look, I’m here to find a spouse, Hu Tao, nothing less!

Wow, you’re almost a Christmas Cake, Hu Tao! Don’t feel bad though, I know some people that are hundreds of years old and have never married!
{small}They’re all youkai, though.
Obviously, I’m going to treat my future spouse right. I may not look it, but I’m good at cooking. And unlike youkai, I’m going to be loyal to my one-and-only!
I don’t have trouble exorcising spirits and the like… but it is nice having someone I can share a drink with and talk youkai extermination… or whatever you do, Hu Tao.
Pranks, huh? I suppose that’ll make you popular with the local fairies. Not that I care what they think when choosing my partner!
Of course I want to talk with everyone here, but you are cute, Hu Tao. Though I’m going to tell our future children we met when I saved you from youkai.
I’m always up for free drinks! Just so long as I don’t have to put any effort into my end. That would defeat the purpose.
You just don’t get it, Yuri! Youkai are the mysterious, the unknown, the unexplainable! If they were to become forgotten or explained away, they would die out! Is that what you want?
Don’t judge me based on my looks, I’m known to spare youkai no mercy. And you’d better learn what youkai are, seeing as a bakeneko like you qualifies.
You’re totally ruled by your base desires, that’s why I can’t stand you youkai at all. And you’re a particularly crass one at that. Maybe your owner should get you spayed.
No one’s going to let a catch like me get away. Not only am I the hard working Shrine Maiden of Genokyo, I’m a great cook and know a bit about brewing sake!
Must be nice to have official funding, I wouldn’t have to work as hard and would still get paid more. My shrine is totally reliant on worshippers’ donations.

We love having festivals at Hakurei shrine, Heris. New Years’ Day, cherry blossom viewings, summer festivals, harvest festivals, sake tastings. While you’re there, be sure to take a moment to pray {small}and donate.
If there’s a party in Gensokyo then you gotta have sake! Plus, people are more willing to donate when they’re soused.
My shrine’s on the barrier that separates Gensokyo from the outside world… Um, there’s a version in the outside world too, but I don’t know where.
Marisa isn’t in it for the money, she just likes pilfering rare items, particularly books on magic. I’m the one in need of cash, but I’d never steal from even the most annoying youkai.
Makes sense, that arm holes in my shirt are big enough that people could see my breasts from the side if I didn’t wrap them up. B-but you’re right that my chest is wonderful.
It’s very beneficial, and it feels like I’ve fought every youkai under the sun… or moon. Plus fairies, spirits, gods, and even other magic-wielding humans.
Eh? W-wait, who are you talking to from Gensokyo? It’s Yukari, isn’t it? It’s always Yukari!
How gross! I have enough pride that I would never degrade myself like that for money. Besides, I need to be the spiritual leader for the humans, I’d never act sexually with any of them.
Er… I admit the Hakurei Shine’s god may be a bit angry at me… since I haven’t been generating much faith for it… since I don’t know what blessings it bestows… or its name.
It’s plenty chaotic, but at least I’m not the only one out there. My friends Marisa, Sanae, Sakuya, Youmu, and others help resolve incidents… when they’re not causing them.
Beings with great magical power, like the sages who first created it, can slip through the barrier. So I found one of them and pestered her until she let me through!
Well… I suppose if you’re going to help me out, and buy me drinks, I’ll let you stay. So what sort of matchmaking experience do you have, anyway?
Resolving incidents is waaay easier than finding a spouse. For those, I wander around and fight youkai I come across until I stumble upon the culprit, but that won’t work here.
I don’t think we have taxes in Gensokyo. Or at least, no one bothers to collect from me, and I’m not seeing any of the money.
I played full shogi once. But the wolf tengu I was playing against beat me in a handful of moves, and I got bored of the entire thing.
Gods and youkai are always causing peace-upending incidents for trivial reasons. It’s my duty as the Hakurei shrine maiden to beat some sense into the culprits.
It’s fine! The only person who knows about this is the old gap youkai Yukari, and the odds of her blabbing to everyone is… um… hmmm…
Well, I’m not going to be a maiden forever, you know. I’ll need to get married and pass on my legacy one day. And there’s no time like the present!
Of course not! The shrine mostly gets its funding through hosting festivals. I also attempt various business ventures… that never make any money.
I have to deal with youkai constantly! Showing up at my shrine, having parties, sunbathing on my veranda, stealing my rice crackers, and playing pranks on me!
Does your religion forbid you from having any relationships at all, Barbara? Um, I wouldn’t do anything before marriage, but most faiths let you do that much.
Exactly! What’s the point of having a handsome and rich spouse if they don’t love you unconditionally and worship the ground you walk on!
As much as I hate to admit it, you seem pretty popular here, Mari. Do you have any suggestions for catching peoples’ eyes? Besides dropping your drawers at the drop of a hat.
Of course I hurt the youkai. Creatures like that only respect violence and power. That’s why I give them a solid whack with my gohei!
Embodiments of concepts? Sounds more like our youkai, human fears given form. I’ve fought manifestations of darkness, of poverty, of jealously… um, of echoes… flowers…
Free clothes? There’s no catch, right? Like you hand over invisible robes and tell me only smart people can see them.
Well, erm… I can only afford the cheap stuff, when I’m not brewing it myself. But as long as there’s plenty of it, what does it matter!
Mysterious and appealing? No way. I know some hags that could fit that bill, but being mysterious just means they’re cagey, confusing, and all around a pain in my backside.
There’s no particular incident I’ve had to resolve— because it’s never ending! That’s why I hate youkai. They’re always causing trouble for me.
”Best in Neo Yokio,” that sounds fancy. Well, I’m the best youkai exterminator in Gensokyo! Which is pretty impressive. Right?
Oh, you mean… those things are popular with girls from the outside world. They’re hard to find in Gensokyo, and sarashi suit me just fine anyway.
What good is money you don’t spend? I’d rather use it to get all the sweets I can eat. And if I don’t have to work or train for it, even better!
They don’t hate me, and we’ve only been to space a couple times. And I don’t care about being the best. But if they get more publicity than me, everyone will forget about Hakurei Shrine!

The worst is when youkai cause some big incident. Like covering Gensokyo in scarlet mist, replacing the moon with a fake one, torching the earth in nuclear hellfire, or flying around on a weird-looking ship.
It’s such a pain, having this duty to resolve incidents. Right, Kaz? Worst of all, it means someone’s always on your case about something!
Calling it a “fetish” makes it sound deviant. Shrine maidens are always beautiful young girls, right? It’s only natural people would be attracted to us!
I don’t know what an “elf” is, but if it’s not human, I’ll probably need to exterminate it… at some point. Doesn’t have to be tonight.
Do you have variants depending on the weather, Erufuda? I’m not so poor I can’t afford a few for each season.
Fries? Fried what? Well, I’ve never gotten fat from eating anything fried, but I also can’t afford to eat fatty food enough to say either way.
Well… sure, I know I deserve to be spoiled. But I don’t need to be waited on hand and foot like some vampire princess. Plus, I’m good at cooking.
Wait, are you propositioning me, Erufuda? I have a strict “no youkai” policy. Plus I have enough freeloaders around my shrine as-is, I’m not looking for a layabout wife.
Hmm… we do the typical purifying rituals… but if you want cures for sickness, you’re better off going to the Hourai pharmacist.
Well, I don’t care that much about continuing the bloodline, I just want a proper lover. Though, I have medicine that lets me… well, it doesn’t matter if it’s a woman or man.

I’ve thought this out pretty well. One, I’m sure most people here are lonely. Two, they’ll be touching themselves while thinking of me, making them sure to fall in love! Three, I’m too beautiful to not want to marry!
Smash… Ballot? I’ve gotten pretty smashed before, but I don’t remember running for any elections. That’s more that Crown Prince Toyosatomimi’s thing.
Youkai extermination and maintaining the Hakurei shrine is my full time job, Emi… but I don’t even get paid for it. I’m totally reliant on donations. Isn’t it sad?
I’m used to taking off my shoes when I go inside anyway, though Westerners like the Scarlet Devil group don’t seem to care.
Winning, losing, it’s all the same to me. I’ve got my own reasons for being here, so I don’t have much of a plan beyond going with the flow.
In any case, I just want people to be turned on during this game. Once their blood starts pumping, they’ll fall in love with me without me having to do any boring courtship rituals.
Gensokyo’s been sealed off for a long while, so I dunno how in fashion these bloomers are in the outside world. But most traditions never change… right?
I’ll trust my intuition when it comes time to pick a betrothed. If I don’t think you’re acceptable, I’ll come back later. It’s still fun to do the things I don’t get to do in Gensokyo anyway.
Hold your damn horses, I’m getting them out. Ugh, it’s always a pain to wrap my sarashi right. Whoever I marry oughta do it for me too.
I don’t know what sort of bizarre trends the outside world has come up with for… this body part, but I’m just… I’m traditional, got it? All natural, no fuss.
I’m not like the Westerners that migrated into Gensokyo, I don’t usually wear my shoes indoors. Taking these off is nothing to me!
Don’t get too carried away now. I can only wed one of you, after all. Maaaaybe two of you, if I like you both enough.
I’ve got my own reasons for playing a game this racy, but I don’t mind showing off and I sure don’t mind other people showing off.
With this game heating up, people are going to be swimming in their passions! They won’t be able to help but fall in love with me.
I hope I don’t appear too old fashioned. My undies, I mean. Gensokyo’s been sealed off from the outside world since… um, a good length of time.
Even if I don’t find a match this go around, I’ve had fun with the, um, sexual aspects. Gensokyo is very traditional, but I have my share of… needs.
T-this is a sight only my husband or wife should see! B-but if one of you is destined to become my future companion, I suppose it’s okay…
Pfft.
…I know what it looks like, but I’m driven by more than libido. I meet people, get to know them, and see if we’re physically compatible. It’s like real dating, but far less effort!
Well… I mean… obviously I would want whoever I choose to... to…. Ugh, fine! Teach me whatever dumb secrets you’ve learned philandering around. Just don’t make it weird!
Are you taking this seriously, Miko? Here I am baring my heart’s secrets, the desires I’ve told no one… Hmph… We’ll pick up this conversation again next go around, right?
I’m not going to wait for her forever. I’m going to find the perfect match for me here, tonight, probably! And I’ll think of them when I touch myself!
Miko, I wouldn’t marry you in a million years. But, I suppose I’m glad we had this talk… thank you.

I know I’m just a poor podunk shrine maiden, but I like knowing I’m beautiful, um… everywhere.
…That said, you’re not tasting, Miko.

What? I- I… Tell your depraved followers to stay away from my shrine, Streaming!
{small}…Is yours not, um…
Hmph, I’m sure they would, Streaming. I have nothing to say to you deviants! …But tell any normal people you know to come visit the Hakurei Shrine. Donations welcome.
Don’t even think about trying any funny business, Streaming. I wiped out an Oni last time she tried to get fresh when I was sauced, I can’t imagine you or your followers faring half as well.
What? I’m not— I mean, yes, I am a great youkai exterminator, but— ugh you’re as bad as that tabloid tengu!
I get why you might think I only want someone with money, but being devoted and loving is more important! …Do rich people really like the shrine maiden types?
H-hey, the hair is what makes it wakamezake, since it looks like wakame seaweed floating there! N-not that I’ve ever touched myself while thinking of Marisa doing it to me!
…Oh yeah, and Aya the lying tabloid tengu. And you’re thinking of Heaven, Streaming… not that I expect to see you there.
I am pure! And let your perverted followers know I’d never do anything like that with them either!
I don’t need any more rumors swirling around about Hakurei being a youkai shrine. Though, you unnerve me more than any demon, Streaming.
Make it fun, huh? I guess I could get drunk before flying off to resolve an incident. But I feel like that’d mostly make things harder.
