I-it’s fine! I don’t need to sweat the small stuff, so long as I do my duty and exterminate youkai. Knowing its name might help me with donations, b-but I can make do.
I wouldn’t mind things being a little less exciting, honestly. Why can’t we solve incidents like “we bottled more sake than we can store” or “fight the villain who gives out free cash”?

I have a sacred duty to protect humans from youkai… and it’d tarnish my reputation if people thought I was just in it for the loot. Still, you’d think those youkai would be more appreciative and donate voluntarily.
S-sexy underwear? I like the thought of wearing something secret just for the one I love… until someone peeks up my skirt while I’m flying around.
Youkai extermination is the sacred duty of the Hakurei Clan, going back generations. That means I’m the best at it in all Gensokyo, so you should never hesitate to hire me!

W-well I wouldn’t know! At least not until after I get married!
{small}Are most Chinese girls this libertine? Meiling always seemed approximately normal.
I think traditions are good. Without tradition, how would you know how to defeat youkai… or that you need to pay pilgrimage to your local shrine?
Even if you’re not the same sort of shrine maiden I am, our methods are pretty similar. Except I don’t get bounties for solving incidents. Or paid at all. What gives?
I’m sure there was a good reason you were told to fear men, Meia. Like, maybe they’re magical beings and if humans ever stopped fearing them they’d lose their reason for existing and fade away.
I’m not “kept away” from anyone, we just don’t get a ton of visitors to my shrine of either gender. It means less work I have to do, so it’s not all bad.
Famous? Hmm, I never thought about it, but I guess everyone in Gensokyo does know me. …Yet none of them donate to my shrine.
I don’t think the human village would approve all that much of me marrying another woman, Hu Tao, but there are enough rumors swirling around me. Who’d pay attention to one more?

I was hoping for someone rich enough they could hire someone else to resolve incidents… somehow.
{small}But being a wife and wife youkai extermination team would be nice.
Oh, that’s the easy part, I can just get some medicine from Doctor Yagokoro that lets two women have kids together. She owes me big time after I saved the moon from Hell’s invasion.
Shave? What am I supposed to— wait, you mean my hairs? That would be too weird, not to mention too much trouble, so it’s not happening.
Hmph. I don’t know what you might think of me, Nami, but I’m not going to abandon someone for some bad luck. I’m sure we’ll figure something out.
What purpose do they need besides stopping people from looking up my skirt when I fly through the sky? They may be out of fashion in the outside world, but most girls in Gensokyo wear them.
The Great Hakurei Barrier isn’t a physical barrier, but a barrier of common sense and perception. The one who made it was the gap youkai Yukari, but she let me through with a little cajoling.
Do you make a lot of money doing your science work, Heris? Then you should definitely stop by one of our many festivals. You can buy all the sake and snacks that you want!
N-no, of course not… It’s not like I care about Youkai. At all! It’s just, um… It’s because if all the youkai died out, I’d be out of a job as a youkai exterminator!
I didn’t come here for some handouts anyway, Barbara. I came here to find a cute wife for me. Someone who will be true to me and take care of me!
Glad you understand, Heris. My mentor Kasen is always complaining that I’m not training or not doing my shrine maiden duties. I need time to relax too!
Yeah, you’d better not be disappointed, Heris. B-but… feel free to praise them as much as you want.
Oh, it makes sense then that people would vote me as their favorite, Pit. I hope that winning includes a cash prize!
Youkai like you are so vulgar, Saki! Humans don’t just engage in sexual acts wantonly! They always wait until they’re married!
That’s good for them, Leon, but I want to be lucky too. Is there a trick to getting good looking people to fawn over you?
Being a shrine maiden is a full-time job, thank you very much. And when I have to go out in the middle of the night because someone stole the moon, I don’t get a yen of overtime!
Youkai don’t need a reason to be annoying. And Yukari is on another whole level of obnoxiousness. Honestly, I should exterminate her on principle when I get back!
Hmmm… maybe my problem is that I don’t have a form fitting suit. Yours shows off all the right curves, ~marinette~, but seems like a hassle to take on and off.
So your god doesn’t care either way, but you still can’t do relationships on account of being an “idol”? All the idols I know are clay warriors, but you look… softer.
Don’t worry, Leon. My intuition says you’re a good guy. And you’re not ugly either! No way will you be a bachelor forever.
As a daughter of the Hakurei clan, I’ve been training to exterminate youkai all my life. It’s my duty… as well as a means to bring in donations.
Try to dodge their attacks and save your bombs for their spellcards? Sorry, it’s just that most of my interactions with those types devolve into battles of bullets.
Of course. Sake is the drink of the gods, so you need to pay close attention at every step. Treat the process like a ritual, Leon, because it is!
Gensokyo’s spell card battles are designed to be nonlethal, so as long as youkai stick to the rules they’ll live to drink tea later. And if not, well…
Youkai, fairies, even gods… all fantastical beings are rooted in the metaphysical. Not that I really think about it too hard. I just pelt them with bullets when they get annoying.
Working hard is a pain… unless it’s brewing sake. Maybe love is a little like sake? You have to get the ingredients right and wait for it to ferment… now I want a drink.
They might be easier to put on, but I’m used to sarashi. Wouldn’t you feel strange if one day you put a different garment around your loins, Leon?
It’s the land of illusion, a hidden world of magic that welcomes the fantastical and rejects the mundane. In other words, everyone there just annoys me.
Obviously I’m going to wear a sarashi, Mitama. Otherwise anyone could look through the side of my shirt and see all they wanted.
Yeah, yeah. You’re just like Sanae from the Moriya Shine, Mitama. It’s not like you put in any effort to grow those.
I’ll say, Arueshale! The worst was the subterranean animism incident. If it wasn’t enough that a nuclear raven threw suns at me, my partners would not stop bugging me the whole time!
Life’s short for us humans, Nami. There’s nothing wrong with a little transitory happiness. We can deal with tomorrow’s hangover tomorrow!
Everyone knows shrine maidens have to be girls, Kaz. And it’s not like you could find a better representative than me, the hardworking but beautiful shaman of paradise!
Sometimes I wish I could leave the responsibility in someone else’s hands and just be a normal girl, but… well, what can you do?
Hey, I feel like you’re silently thinking something judgmental right now! Ugh, you’re just like those smug sages, Meia!
I know, right? Maybe I do get drunk too often, and seem a bit lazy, and might act grumpy at times, but I’m beautiful! And good at cooking.
W-well, it’s not like my hair color is exactly front page news on a slow news day. But we all agree that what happens here stays here, right?
I’ve got other plans I could put into motion to make some quick yen, Jim, but it’d be nice to have someone to drink sake with.
The Inventory will keep a close eye on all our clothing, right? It’d be bad publicity if my shoe got lost and turned into a youkai.
Trying to win at this game is too exhausting. Really, trying to do anything is a pain. That’s why I need some nice, good-looking person to take care of me.
So long as I get a nice suitor to take care of me, and take them home to flaunt to my boring mentor Kasen, I could care less about the rest of this game!
It’s drafty…
This dumb game is just an excuse to see nudity, right? As long as the rest of you get worn down too, I don’t care if none of you meet my standards for marriage.
Yeah, yeah. Other people have fatter breasts. These are well-shaped, compliment them or move on.
Just… Someone please marry me after all this is over. I kinda already bragged about it to Kasen.
I’m the best incident solver around! I’ve exterminated countless youkai on my own— I don’t care if I’m in my socks or not!
And to think, all this could be yours if you took me as your wife and pampered me! Please only charming and handsome men and/or smart and beautiful women apply.
I’m going to put all my effort into winning! But not during this next round. Putting in all my effort at once is too troublesome, that’s why it’d be nice to have someone to take care of me.
I’ll be leaving here with a doting fiancee of my own! And I’ll rub it in my dumb mentor Kasen’s face! She said this was a terrible idea, you know.
…And that’s how I take off my skirt.
So all the rest of you, don’t be afraid to flaunt what you’ve got! Even if I don’t get a spouse, I’ll still get a show!
S-so here you are. No touching, though~! We definitely have to be married before you can think of that.
Say, Ignatz was it? You mentioned something about being an artist? I read in a magazine from the outside world some paintings go for millions of Yen!
Jim, huh? You look big and mean. Don’t think you can push me around though— I’ve used my sacred needles on bigger than you.
Jim, you’re big. That means you eat a lot of meat, right? I wish I could eat big, fancy meals all the time— how do you do it?
I heard you were an angel, Pit, but I’ve fought ones way less soft-looking than you. What makes you so special?
Say, Yuno, that card game you play… do you make money doing that? Like, are you a professional gambler, or do you work a real job to make ends meet?
So wait, are you sent off to resolve incidents by some do-nothing god in your world? We’re more alike than I thought.
So what exactly does a “special agent” do where you’re from, Leon? From the sounds of things, you’re basically a youkai exterminator.
I thought about your suggestion, Leon, but I couldn’t ask the Sages of Gensokyo for a paycheck. Those old biddies are unreliable, smarmy, and half the time they’re the cause of the incidents.
Hey Kaz, you’re loaded, right? Why not pay someone, like me, big bucks to do your youkai extermination for you?
Your whole family’s rich, right Kaz? Then why work at all? Let the fat-cats deal with their own cursed trinkets and spend your days lazing around.
I’m not sure exactly what manner of cat youkai you are, Felix, but why are you skulking around here?
Are you really the only youkai exterminator in your city, Kaz? Gensokyo’s way smaller, but I still have my fair share of interfering rivals.
This is what happens when you tangle with me, after all. I'm the Hakurei shrine maiden who silences crying children!
We’re not playing for money, so there’s no reason to be stingy. The only thing you stand to lose is some pride, and yours can’t be worth much.
To the victor go the spoils! Spoil me, ~name~.
Don’t mind me, just keeping my eyes peeled. The Tengu tabloids would have a field day if they could snap a picture of me here.
I’ve never had a man undress for me before today, but I could get used to this feeling of power. Hehe, submit before me, ~name~!
Next time, I’ll bring sweets and tea with me. I’m sure it’d make this viewing even better.
I hope no incidents occur while I’m gone. I’m sure Sanae can handle anything, being a shrine maiden herself and all, but I don’t like the idea of my shrine falling further into irrelevancy.
This week was such a pain. I had to knock some sense into Tenshi, Cirno, Aya, Remilia, Cirno, Clownpiece, Seija, and Cirno again. In other words, make this good, ~name~!
I wish they had nice pillows or something for us to sit on, at least between rounds. I know they want us to show off, but we’re all focused on ~name~ right now anyway.
I still haven’t made up my mind about ~name~, so this’ll be a good opportunity to check him out. You hear that, ~name~? Don’t screw this up!
If some incident get started while I’m away, someone else is going to have to solve it. I can’t exactly rush over looking like this, huh?
Are you nervous getting naked when I’m like this, ~name~? Why not have a cup of sake to relax? And while you’re at the bar, how about getting me some too?
Does seeing me like this make you self-conscious, ~name~? Could it be… because I’m the girl of your dreams? Awww, I knew it!
I know my beauty is on full display right now, ~name~, but don’t let that distract you.
You did your best, and I get to see a liiittle bit more of you. I’d say we both did good this round.
If we’re going to get married, it’s important to know— do you prefer red miso or white miso in your miso soup?
I didn’t play this game for the fun of the cards, hard as it is to believe. I wanna see something good.
I’ve heard boys can’t wait to show themselves off in front of a beautiful girl… well, I want to see you too, but no funny business before we’re married.
I didn’t come here to show off, though I knew that’d be part of the deal. I wanted to see everyone else showing off, so let’s see what ~name~ has to offer.
Hey Marinette, how’d you and the pretty boy get together? He seems decent in terms of looks and personality, I wouldn’t mind marrying someone like that.
Did you seriously just stumble upon this place, Miko? Just my luck. I can’t even threaten to tell your followers because that’d implicate me as well.
So let me guess, Miko. You’re here for more philandering? To find a tall, busty woman and invite her to join your made-up harem?
I almost hate to ask, Miko, but… when you were mortal, and crown prince or whatever, did you have your own royal harem?
Say, Miko… according to Sanae’s textbooks, Prince Shoutoku had children, right? How’d you pull that off if you weren’t physically, um, a man?
Don’t you think it’s a little gross, Miko? Having a bunch of women slobbering on top of you? It seems more uncomfortable than sexy to me.
I hate the idea of asking, but I can’t help myself. What’s your actual, um, experience? With sex, I mean.
You’re just here to find a girl to spend the night, right? Unbelievable. I’m here to find my one true love, to spend my whole life with!
Miko’s turn to… well, I know how much you like to show off.
Yuna, stay calm, but it appears you’re being possessed by two ghosts. Don’t worry. I’ll exterminate them for you.
Meia? You’re the “dreaded team leader”, right? I’ve never seen armor as sleek as yours.

Look at you with your long blonde hair and your dolled up face and your plunging neckline and your seductive laugh. I’m gonna send you home crying into your girlfriend’s chest!
…I wish that was me.
Yuri, was it— I think you were the one talking about books earlier? I’m a big big fan of murder mysteries! Oh, but I read all kinds.
Zoe, was it? Do you work for some seafaring merchants or something? I heard you talking about “shipping” earlier.
A cat, huh? What’re you doing here playing a game for humans? Shouldn’t you be making yourself useful chasing mice somewhere?
I’ve met oni more cheerful than you, Revy. I’m sure if you smiled a bit, even you could snag a husband or wife as easy as I will!
Say, Nami, are you some kind of sailor girl? That sounds like it’d be a fun job! Sailing to new lands, drinking rum all day, relaxing in the sea breeze…
Are you some sort of shrine maiden or priestess where you’re from, Fina? You have a similar air to me… not to mention similar sleeves.
Since you’re a maid, Noelle, are you here to find a suitor too? I’m sure your mistress is a layabout who works you to the bone, it’s the same in Gensokyo.
What kind of music do you play, Critical? It better not be the obnoxious loud noise some of the youkai have been blasting lately.
Ugh, a newspaper reporter. I have to deal with those back home, and the last thing I need is word of my being here getting out.
You seem pretty tough for a human, Syrenne. Are you a sort of Youkai exterminator where you’re from? Protecting humans from evil and all that?
So you’re a princess, Petra? What does a princess of Brigid actually do in terms of royal duties?
Hu Tao, was it? You have an air of death around you. I don’t think you’re a ghost or jiang-shi yourself, but that might be worse.
Meia, you need to relax, throw some parties, and find yourself a nice girl to drink sake with. Otherwise you’ll find yourself waking up a wrinkly old maid someday.
I don’t think I’ve ever seen a creature like you, Miku. Your outfit’s weird enough, but what’s with your voice? You sound like you’re speaking through a gramophone.
Hey Stocking, you’re an angel who got banished from Heaven, right? I know a delinquent celestial who got kicked out of there, but angels are different sorts of beings.
Are you a youkai exterminator yourself where you come from, Samus? I know an enchanted suit of armor when I see it.
So, Hu Tao, what it is you really do? No ordinary undertaker carries around spirits or knows how to use magic.
Why are you here, Remi? Did Yukari tell you what I was up to?
Unlike Vampires, who are content to shut themselves in a coffin all day, humans have certain needs. We need companionship, and… well, you know…

You youkai only care about your own desires— you’re all shameless. You’ll do whatever with whoever.
{small}You know it’s all your faults I’ve become open to liking women.
So tell me, Remi… have you really had sex before? What, um, was it like? I mean— how does a youkai engage in that sort of thing?
…I’ll be honest, Remi. I know plenty of humans engage in premarital sex. I didn’t want to admit it, because… well, it’s embarrassing.
Flan? Oh right! Earlier today Koishi was bothering me, so I gave her a bunch of candy and told her to share it with her friends. I guess she must be on a sugar high right now.
So, Hu Tao, if we’re getting married… it’d be nice to know more about you. How’d you get into the undertaker/youkai exterminator business?
Hu Tao, what makes you so interested in me? I’m not used to people being so forward and open. It’s nice, but why me?
Hu Tao, are you… experienced? I don’t care either way, but I’m a virgin. You don’t mind, right?
Oh, you’re taking off your hat now? We’ve already seen all of you, so what does the top of your head matter?
Fluttershy, you seem awfully jumpy. Are you unwell? Or are you trying to hide something?
W-wait, you’re doing a prayer, here? I can’t let myself fall behind! Let’s also give thanks to the god of the Hakurei Shrine!
I didn’t expect to meet another holy woman here. I’m looking to find a fine husband or wife, but why did you come, Barbara?
It must have been rough leaving the Silver Shrine, Fina. Even if it was lonely there, it was the only world you’ve ever known. I can’t imagine leaving Gensokyo for good…
Are you one of those hobgoblins? I didn’t even know they made female ones. Shouldn’t you be off cleaning someone’s house?
Are you a princess, Fischl? Really? Because you remind me of a certain self-styled vampire princess from back home.
Tomoko, huh? You look rather gloomy. That’s a youkai’s curse if I’ve ever seen one! All right Tomoko, prepare to get exorcized!
You don’t look like anything special to me, Cynthia, but from the sounds of things you’re a powerful shikigami user. Is it true you’ve made dragons your servants?
I’ve seen labcoats like that in books and worn by science types before, Heris. Do you invent stuff and then sell it for big bucks?
I didn’t expect to meet a magic wielding human here. We have some Western magicians in Gensokyo. Are you any good, Lux?
Ganyu, eh? Are you with one of the beast gangs in the Animal Realm? You look a lot like the Toutetsu lady who runs one of the “families” there.
You called yourself a “blade”, Kora. Do you mean literally that you’re a tsukumogami— a sword that has been around so long it developed a spirit?
So, Nami, do you have any daring stories of high sea adventures? I fought a mermaid once, but she lives in a lake and isn’t that strong.
Rosa, right? Is it true you enslave monsters to do battle with your enemies? You must be a powerful witch to pull something like that off.
It seems like a lot of work, so no way I’d do it… but Yuri, you think that since you like reading novels so much, you’d want to write some yourself?
Fluttershy, if you wanted to get over your shyness why did you jump directly into a sexual game like this? Aren’t there less embarrassing activities you could try first?
Listen, you. Monika. You better not make things difficult for me. I didn’t come here intending to put in any sort of effort, let alone seal a troublesome being away.
You’re awfully cranky, even for a youkai, Nagamimi. What, did you see your reflection in a puddle and decide to go on a rampage? Who knows what sets you youkai off.

So Saki, what brings you here anyway? Trying to find a romantic partner to offset your terrible luck?
I’ve got a duty to protect Gensokyo, but being a pirate does sound a bit romantic. You get to sail around the seas, dig up treasure, and get drunk off rum!
For a servant spirit, you’re pretty lazy and oblivious, Kora. I can’t imagine how someone like you could take care of anyone. I’d want my lover to be totally the opposite!
We both have it rough, huh Barbara? Do you at least get any respect? Everyone spreads baseless rumors about me, like that I’m lazy or that I let youkai visit my shrine freely.
Ugh, what’s with the cutesy act, Cagliostro? Don’t you have any pride? Carry yourself with some dignity.
You’ve been gushing about mercenary work for a while now, Leonie. It must pay pretty well then.
Your wings are too big, Arueshalae, can’t you put them away? What are you anyway, some kind of Western dragon?
You’re not throwing in the towel yet, Emi? What’s the point of being competitive in a casual game like this? There’s not even a cash prize!
You’re such a nice girl Sayori! Too nice. People only act like that when they’re hiding a deep dark secret.
You’re one of those pompous religious types, aren’t you L’Arachel? Hmph, you people will say anything to sell some charms or swindle some offerings!
You’ve got the shifty look of someone who’s planning something, Aimee. Out with it. I came here with every intention to relax, you know.
Right, this is too stupid for me to bother with. I’m leaving. Not the game, I mean, but the bounds of reality.
If Aimee’s not done, neither am I. “Fantasy Nature”!
If Aimee were a youkai, I’d have exterminated her by now. Humans like her are beyond my jurisdiction though, no matter how annoying they are. Anyway: “Fantasy Nature”, you get the drift…
You know, using Fantasy Nature is a lot of work. Well, all I’m doing is just floating off, but still— it’s a lot of work!
This isn’t the first time I’ve seen a youkai going out and about in disguise, Saki. You better not have any ulterior motive— I’m not above interrupting this game to perform an exorcism.
Mari, have you ever died? You have that sort of still air about you. Oh, no disrespect if you have— I got my soul stolen and sent to Hell once before too!
I’ve met plenty of princesses— or self-proclaimed princesses— in Gensokyo. You don’t have to put on airs. Grab a drink and relax like a normal person.

What’s your religion anyway, L’Arachel? You’re not Shinto and you’re obviously not Buddhist. Maybe Taoist? I know a certain crown prince a lot like you.
Mari, why are you here if you already have someone? That “Hero” guy? Hmph, people should be loyal to their one and only is what I think.

Ladybug lost. I’ve got pretty strong luck too, but it doesn’t manifest outside of my shrine maiden duties. Seems you’re the same.
You seem pretty proud of your strength, Arueshalae. But not proud of being a youkai? I don’t get the mismatch, what sort of youkai runs from their very nature?
Hey Marinette, looks like you got the ghost of a bug flitting around you. Want me to exorcize it?
Sounds like you have a beloved of your own with that catboy you keep mentioning, Marinette. How do hardworking and cute girls like us meet good partners?
Are you a shrine maiden, Rin? Something about your outfit reminds me of the uniforms we wear in Gensokyo.
Ooh, Miss Kyoko! You’re a detective, right? I can tell, I’ve read all sorts of mystery stories. Say, does that mean someone is getting murdered tonight?
Hehe, I’m happy to meet a fellow shrine maiden. As long as you don’t move into Gensokyo and siphon off my visitors, Mitama, I think we’ll get along just fine!
Mitama, you’re in some army or something, right? I’d hate being forced to deal with a large, rigid group like that.
Does your outfit let you move around comfortably on the battlefield, Mitama? It’s not very “traditional,” but neither is mine.
You act so unflappable, Arueshalae. You’re just like Yukari. Or Okina. Or any of the other dozen youkai who make it their life’s mission to hang out at my shrine and annoy me!
So… Magical? Um, is “Magical” your name? Are you a human who practices magic?
You seem pretty upbeat, Kyouko. That’s good— I know I’d never find a partner if I acted mopey all the time.
Are you some kind of Western youkai, Erufuda? I’m more familiar with Japanese youkai, but you look a bit like an Oni. You know, those big, gluttonous muscle-heads?
Don’t you feel bad being nothing more than a thief, Nami? Pirates are all just waterlogged bandits in the novels I read.
Humans are transient beings, Meia. We’re not like youkai, who can live thousands of years. That’s why it’s our duty to enjoy life to the fullest!
Oooh, Miss Kyoko, do you have any idiosyncratic tics you always do when you’re investigating? All the best fictional detective do stuff like that.

Jura, I can’t just tell someone I lo— like them. It’s too embarassing!
{small}I have my pride as a shrine maiden to think about…
Toph, you’re blind, right? That means you can’t see how cute I am. Why even come here, then?
You remind me of a certain other shrine maiden that I know, Suzuya. Are all outside world girls as easygoing as you?
Yumeko, are you able to make money by gambling? Like real money? Say, that uniform looks like it’s made from some nice material…
Well, of course someone’s got to lose. It’s not a big deal.
If this were an incident, and you were a youkai, I’d be whacking you with my gohei right about now! Good thing you just have to take off some clothing, ~name~!
Another win for me! Once my hard work is over, I can’t wait to go home and goof off.
This would be easier if the rest of you didn’t put up so much of a fight. You know I do want to see more of you.
I’m sure you’re fretting about how to best impress me, ~name~, but I’d be fine with you taking off most anything!
For a token donation to the Hakurei Shrine, I’ll perform a ritual to ensure your victory in the next round, ~name~.
It’s too bad you lost, but I do want to see all of you. S-so, you should be happy because of that.
Please just strip normally. I’m getting exhausted just imagining the rigamarole a youkai would go through stripping. They always have to be the center of attention.
Don’t worry, ~name~, I won’t tell anyone anything about this. And you won’t tell anyone from the human village. Right?
I’m fine with anyone, so long as we get closer to seeing someone naked!
I’d never be able to enjoy this kind of thing in Gensokyo. The humans would find it scandalous and the youkai would find some way to make it obnoxious.
A victory for me, and I didn’t even have to raise my gohei or prep a spell card. I could get used to easy wins like this.
Sorry, I got distracted. I’ll take off my— oh, ~name~ lost? Well, I probably deserved to win.

There’s no reason to be concerned, even the winner will likely lose most everything. I-I’m just saying that because you’ll harsh the mood if you’re upset!
It all comes down to luck, doesn’t it? Outside of youkai extermination I’m pretty unlucky, so I can’t feel too bad about you losing.
Well, if you didn’t want to strip, you should have played better. I wanna see you in the buff, so I’m trying my best.
If ~name~ agrees to go home with me as my bride, should I try cooking a new recipe to celebrate? Or would it be better to do one of my staples?

It’s ~name~’s turn to go? Not that I’m excited, though.
{small}But I may be a little bit… turned on.
Don’t fret, ~name~. I left an offering to Ōkuninushi no Mikoto, the Shinto god of marriage, before coming here. Your fate as my lover is sealed no matter what you take off.
I’m sure your body is very beautiful, ~name~. And I’m sure the sight of you pleasuring yourself is also beautiful. Anyway, get going so we can reach that point.
I guess if we did get married, you’d see me like this a lot, ~name~. You wouldn’t get tired of me, would you?
Erm, give me a moment. I need to prepare myself for seeing a more naked version of ~name~.
Winning and losing doesn’t matter, mostly because I already lost. What really matters is that I get to see a sweet little view from you!
I don’t think anyone’s going to fall in love with me unless they get to my level and let their passions run wild. Be sure to lose lots, okay ~name~?
Don’t be afraid, ~name~. Losing the game was actually pretty thrilling… and I’m sure it’d be even more thrilling with you there next to me.
A draw? I guess no one has to lose, but it still feels like I was wasting my time.
So, nothing happens? That’s a disappointment. I know it doesn’t matter here, but I’d still rather win outright.

I’m keeping a lookout for any youkai afoot. It’d be a problem if they recognized— I mean, attacked me.

Hurry it up, I would have had enough time here to warm up a flask of sake!
{small}I wish I had a flask of sake.

What a boring choice. Maybe I’ll take a quick break, rest up a bit.

Next person who loses, please give me something better.

Great, great. I make nothing exterminating youkai, and I was hoping I could at least have some cheap entertainment doing this. Guess that was too much to ask.
I’m sure those fairies are preparing all sorts of pranks for me when I get back. What stupid, annoying creatures! …I wonder how those tykes are doing anyway.

You’re not like any youkai I’ve seen before, ~name~. You remind me of a tsukumogami, an object that has grown a spirit, but that’s not it either. Well, whatever, I’ll figure you out eventually.
So, you’re a god or a divine spirit or whatever, ~name~? That’s a pain. I don’t mind you having some followers here and there, but I can’t let my shrine’s regular patrons get stolen away!
~Name~, you remind me of one of those weak-ish demons I’ve seen around Makai. I think that assistant librarian at the Scarlet Devil Mansion is the same? I could be wrong, though.
Ahhhh, I could sure go for some garlic gyoza dumplings right now. What about you, ~name~?
Does your tattoo bestow any special blessings onto you, ~name~? Or did you just like the way it looks? Seems like it’d be more of a pain than it’s worth either way, though.
Don’t even think about using your sword against me, ~name~. I’ve dealt with too many idiots with mystical blades when I’m supposed to work, thank you very much.
Is that a normal sword or a magical one, ~name~? I’m not particularly fond of either… mostly because when some idiot draws theirs, it means I have to start trying.
What a strange little metal wand you have there, ~name~. It reminds me of Marisa’s magical furnace, but a lot weaker and oddly shaped.
Some youkai around Youkai Mountain were playing a game using contraptions like the one you have, ~name~. But then they accidentally hit some humans, and even lied about it to my face!
Are you proud of your stick, ~name~? It looks nice, but as the gohei I hold shows, true power comes from the one who wields it! Namely, me!
With all that armor, ~name~, you must be a powerful knight of knights. Good, that means if any youkai show up, you can deal with them.
I don’t know who wears a cape, ~name~, except those trying to be the new messiah. Is that your angle?

I couldn’t help but notice that crown on your head, ~name~. Are you a ~target.ifMale(king or prince|queen or princess)~? I like the idea of marrying into wealthy nobility, but I don’t think I could handle the politics.
How’d you come to wear an eyepatch, ~name~? Not that I care, but you hear stories of youkai hunters losing an eye… but you also hear about weirdoes who wear those just to look cool.
I don’t really pay attention to trends, but hats are fashionable among the girls of Gensokyo. I don’t know how popular ~name~’s would be, though.
Is that jewelry expensive, ~name~? I’ve never worn jewelry before— you would buy some for your wife, wouldn’t you?
Sometimes I think I’d like to have a maid of my own, but then I think to how all the servants I know are odd people. I… haven’t seen anything tonight that changes my mind.
Is there a reason you need to hide your identity, ~name~, and should I be concerned? Though, I’d be more concerned if you thought that made you look cool.
Are you a student, ~name~? I’m not sure the reason behind such a strange outfit, but the girl from the outside world, Sumireko, complains about hers.
Say, ~name~, are you part of some military? I only ask because the moon rabbit Reisen wears an outfit like that… though it may have just been chosen because it was cute.
Why are you hiding your eyes, ~name~? Do you not want to be recognized? Are you keeping a disfigurement secret? Or are you just hungover and trying to hide it?
Why did you go out and buy a swimsuit when you’re just going to take it off here, ~name~? Seems cheaper to wear your regular clothes and skinny dip after.
Your constant hostility is really starting to get on my nerves, ~name~. Either make good on your threats so I can exterminate you or shut up and enjoy the game!
I think this game is more fun when everyone’s upbeat, like me and ~name~. It’ll also be more fun when ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ takes off something good, so hop to it!
I wonder if we’ll see any of ~name~’s great power. I haven’t felt anything from ~target.ifMale(him|her)~ yet, but I better be on my guard.
Most people would be embarrassed to show off like this in front of strangers, but ~name~ seems to relish the chance. Is ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ even human?
I’m not up-to-date on fashion trends, but I can feel the quality of ~name~’s outfit. Do you spend all your money on clothing, or would you have some left over for your wife?
Since I wear the same uniform all the time, I don’t pay any attention to fashion. Still, I can tell ~name~ has a stylish outfit. Are you the type to make sure your wife is well-dressed too?
If you’re going to be moping all the time, you don’t have to stay, ~name~. Actually, your attitude makes me look more desirable by comparison, so I’d rather you didn’t leave.
~Name~ seems so out of ~target.ifMale(his|her)~ depth… I’m not experienced either, but at least I’ve read naughty books to prepare myself.

~Name~’s acting like ~target.ifMale(he|she)~’s possessed by an evil spirit or youkai, but I don’t feel a malignant aura attached to ~target.ifMale(him|her)~. I guess I can just pelt ~target.ifMale(him|her)~ with talismans and see what happens.
You seem like the sort of person who’d make a good ~target.ifMale(husband|wife)~, ~name~. You’d take good care of your spouse, wouldn’t you?
I wish ~name~ would knock it off with that attitude. I get enough criticism back home from all the sages, and you’re just being rude about it!

I bet I could attract a ton of visitors by conscripting ~name~ and turning ~target.ifMale(him|her)~ into a shrine maiden! ~target.ifMale(He’s|She’s)~ so cute, ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ could be like a mascot!
~Name~ is one of those people who love to talk about their dumb obsessions. If we don’t head ~target.ifMale(him off now, he’ll|her off now, she’ll)~ keep going forever.
I-is ~name~ trying to get a rise out of us? ~target.ifMale(H-he|Sh-she)~ goes beyond forward… even youkai aren’t so animalistic when giving into their passions!
You don’t talk much, huh, ~name~? I like that! Means less of a chance of you annoying me.
S-say, ~name~, are you trying to seduce me? Well, it won’t work! Unless you’re serious about entering into a committed long term relationship, in which case, it does.

Would it kill you to lighten up, ~name~? Geez, you’re as bad as the sages in Gensokyo… always voicing concern or fussing with me…
{small}but I guess it’d make you a good ~target.ifMale(husband|wife)~.
You’re acting like this is the first time you’ve seen other human beings in years, ~name~. Sure, I’ve holed myself up reading my favorite mystery novel series but that only lasted a few days.
You’d better speak up, ~name~, I don’t think you’re going to win anyone’s hand in marriage acting so shy. …Don’t worry about the others, if they make you uncomfortable I’ll hammer them with my gohei.
I know I hate it when people lecture me, but don’t be totally silent either, ~name~. I want a ~target.ifMale(husband|wife)~ who can at least sing my praises!
~Name~ is so open about ~target.ifMale(himself|herself)~ it’s almost gross. No way would ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ stay loyal… unlike me.
You clearly know a lot of little facts and whatnot, ~name~. The Moriya Shrine maiden, Sanae, is also pretty smart— but on the reverse side, she doesn’t have an ounce of common sense.
It feels like you’re hiding your true feelings, ~name~. I could never be like that! I always say what I want. Unless I don’t want to.
~Name~ thinks ~target.ifMale(he’s|she’s)~ so funny. I have to deal with the fairies’ pranks all the time, I’m not really in the mood for pointless jokes.
You seem a little too obsessed, ~name~. Like Junko, the vengeful sagacious spirit. Except I don’t mind her because she mostly just bothers the moon people.

I read in an outside world magazine that some artists’ work gets sold for a lot of money! Oh, but that they’re all starving and don’t get famous until after they die. I don’t suppose there’s any point in becoming ~name~’s wife/assistant then.
I can feel that you have a lot of energy, ~name~. The closest thing to sports in Gensokyo are danmaku competitions, and I get my fill of battles of bullets as it is.
You remind me of some of the youkai hunters I’ve seen once or twice in the human village, ~name~. Well, don’t try to tackle any real danger. Leave that to me, okay?
A lot of people seem to recognize ~name~… could it be that ~target.ifMale(he’s|she’s)~ a famous youkai exterminator in the outside world? More importantly, is ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ rich?
Are you another one of those religionists, ~name~? I’m wise to your self-serving tricks. Don’t think you’ll be taking any of my precious donations!
Are you some kind of crook, ~name~? Not that I care, seeing as my jurisdiction begins and ends with youkai. If I cared about human criminals, I’d haul off my thieving friend Marisa.
Why do you feel the need to act so tough, ~name~? Why don’t you come down to your local shrine instead, I’m sure prayer and a bit of tithing will send you on the right track.
~Name~ isn’t the first detective I’ve had to endure. Satori once came up from the underground to track down an escaped damned spirit. She can read minds, so it was basically cheating.
You’ve got an aura around you like you know how to handle yourself in a fight, ~name~. Like Meiling, the gate guard at the mansion. Except she’s no good in danmaku battles, so she’s useless.
You’re a powerful sorcerer, right, ~name~? I assumed all “Gamers” were. Sumireko warned me that in the outside world, there are “forbidden gamer words”.
~Name~ said ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ was an idol… that means you were crafted by the creator god Keiki Haniyasushin, right? Funny, you look normal… haniwa sure have come a long way, huh?
I’ve dealt with knights like ~name~ before, and it’s a pain. They’re always so intransigent, especially when defending some master. Like, I already beat you, what are you doing showing up again?
Ugh, ~name~ is one of those self-serving newspaper writers, just like the tengu. No thanks. Journalists are like whores, they only exist to sell themselves.
There are a lot of girls with magical powers like yours in Gensokyo, ~name~. Like the ability to destroy anything. Or manipulate the unconscious. Stuff like that.
Are you a doctor, ~name~? Do you sell pills for cheap? I could buy some here, then sell them in Gensokyo to undercut the Hourai Pharmacy. I’ll make a mint!
Are you part of some army or something, ~name~? Your uniform isn’t nearly as cute as the moon rabbits’. Though knowing their leaders, they spent more time on the outfits than anything else.
What sort of music do you play, ~name~? I like most of the groups in Gensokyo, but this one youkai band just yells and bangs these metallic guitars.
The tanuki leader Mamizou once dressed up in an outfit like yours, ~name~. I think she called herself the “Em Eye Bee?” It had something to do with little green men from outer space.
Say, ~name~, what is a “police” anyway? Is that like a youkai exterminator in the outside world? …Am I a police?
“Science” is that weird outside world form of magic, right ~name~? Seems pointless for me to learn about it since as I’ve got spiritual power… unless there’s money involved, of course.
The song of the night sparrow youkai, Mystia, blinds whoever who hears it. Which is fine by me, because it means I don’t have to look at her stupid face. Are you going to sing too, ~name~?
I wonder what ~name~’s class is like. Miss Keine teaches children at the temple school in the human village, but I only ever needed to learn how to be a shine maiden.
You better not be thinking of pocketing anything, ~name~. I’ve dealt with my friend Marisa enough, I’ll know immediately if you pinch one grain of rice!

Oh, so you’re a witch, ~name~? That’s… I’m sure you’re a hard worker… but don’t try stealing anything!
{small}Ugh, what am I saying?

Are you an ordinary magician, ~name~? Most humans who study magic become youkai, since there’s too much to learn in one lifetime. It takes dedication to be a human witch… dedication to magic, not me, that is…
Are you one of those people who’s never able to settle down, Ma— ~name~? I can’t stand it. Stop goofing off in your magic shop and realize someone out there would like to stay by your side forever.
There’s something about ~name~… well, whatever. It’s not like it affects me, so why spend effort worrying about it?
~Name~ was acting like ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ was cheating, but since ~target.ifMale(he’s|she’s)~ still losing ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ must be pretty bad at it. No reason to worry.
~Name~ isn’t even trying to win, is ~target.ifMale(he|she)~? Great! I wish the youkai in Gensokyo learned from ~target.ifMale(his|her)~ example!
Are you from Hell, ~name~? You have the same weird fashion sense as the goddess there, Hecatia Lapislazuli.
You’ve got a nice outfit, ~name~. I’m glad someone here can dress like a normal person, unlike the others from the outside world.
Don’t take any pictures of me please, ~name~. The Tengu reporter Hatate can use her spirit photography to look up any picture already out there, and steal it for her news stories.
You know, ~name~, the fastest way to a woman’s heart is through her stomach. If you were kind enough to share some of your food, I’m sure I’d fall head over heels for you!
I can tell just from looking at you— you’re broke too, huh ~name~? It figures I’m not the only one with the idea of finding a nice partner to ease my burden. Well, I’m not going to lose to you!
I can tell from your aura you’re well versed in magic, ~name~. I didn’t think anyone from the outside world even studied magic— or if they did, that it was a bunch of cheap tricks.
I heard someone call you a “psychic”, ~name~. Are you one of those fake psychics who only tells people what they want to hear? Or worse, are you one of those annoying real psychics?
I can clearly sense that ~name~ isn’t a living person. Is ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ a phantom, then? It’s different than a ghost, at least.
I can tell just by looking at ~name~ that ~target.ifMale(he|she)~ must be loaded! Take my hand in marriage, ~name~, and you can buy me expensive dinners and pay off my overdue book renter’s fees!
~Name~’s got a ton of money, if I married ~target.ifMale(him|her)~ I could laze around all day! Mamizou called that being a “trophy wife”. That’s a good thing… right?
Aw shit. Its tha motha fuckin TAG TEMPLATE. If you're seeing this in-game, please bug report. If you opened this case in the CE fuck you.
Oh! You’re that thunder spirit! Miko’s consort from the Soga clan or whatever.
Well, I think it’s gross, having Tojiko and still proposi\tioning other girls! If I had a wife who took care of me as well as Tojiko does you, I’d never look elsewhere!
Right, I remember Sanae being confused because the books all showed you as a man. I guess it’s very like you to adjust your appearance to suit the times.
That doesn’t answer my question, Miko, but I should have expected it. Your lust is so thick, you can’t keep it contained in the loins you have, huh?
Oh, um… I suppose that fits you. In erotic tales I’ve read, there are people who “switch” between roles. And you do like to insert yourself… um, into situations, I mean.
Right, so, your experience isn’t half of what you’re presenting it to be. I know you well enough to figure you wouldn’t be evasive if you could lord numbers over anyone.

B-but… dating is a pain! Do I have to actually spend ridiculous amounts of effort to possibly be happy?
{small}…How do I know what I really want?
Have you ever thought about investing in a proper pair of bloomers, Miko? Don’t think I didn’t notice the hairs poking out of your fundoshi.
Wakasagihime the mermaid? There was an incident, she was there, obviously we’re going to fight. Normally mermaids are docile, but during that incident the weak youkai were made to go on a rampage.
I’ve fought giants before, and zombies, but never both at once. Being a bigger target and a bit rotten, you’d think they’d go down easier than one or the other.

Don’t worry Nami, if I ever see any pirate, I’ll obliterate them for you!
Oh, you dropped something. Say, is that your photograph?
O-okay, Jura. Let’s say I happened to want a girlfriend of my own. How would I go about getting one?
We’re the same age, but you’re in charge of your own squad. Plus you have such an air of maturity. You must be a real hard worker!
Fandom? I have some fans at home, but it hasn’t been hot enough to use them recently.
Was there anyone else at the Great Silver Shrine? Gensokyo is separated from the outside world, but at least people from within still visit my shrine… sometimes.
I don’t sense that you’re cursed, but you’ve got a mean looking face! You have to be planning to eat me bones and all with an appearance like that!
I try to figure out who did it, but I’m not very good at it. Usually I end up fingering everyone at some point, and in the end I still wasn’t right.
I guess carrying around ghosts would explain it. Though I haven’t met an undertaker so enthusiastic about their work before.
Wait, your family has a trading company? I mean— I love art! What do you like to paint? Landscapes? Still lifes? Pretty girls?
“Alternative metal”? Plenty of instruments are made out of metal, but I don’t know of a good alternative to the material. Why can’t you just play regular instruments?
So there’s no one person you serve, you’re the maid for a whole country? All the maids and servants I know are slavishly devoted to some mistress.
I suppose there are youkai of the sea as well. But it can’t be that scary, since I’ve seen some cute sea creatures too. So, anyway, what does your crew do?
Whatever, could you just leave? That is, I want you to leave this world. I don’t need you getting in my way tonight.
Maybe Patchy never told you how the birds and the bees work Remi, but humans need to do this thing called “sex” to make babies. And it feels good to do it.
But what really makes youkai gross is how promiscuous you all are! You’ll sleep with someone one night and a different person the next! Like animals!
What sort of things feel good? Not like I would ever do something like that with the likes of you, but it might be useful knowledge for my future spouse. I need to know how to be a good wife.
You know how I need to put myself up on a pedestal so the human village gives me their faith. But I’m not all that close to them. The idea of engaging romantically with any of them is just awkward.
Well, it doesn’t matter. The Scarlet Devil Mansion gets blown up often enough anyway. You can just rebuild.
From the sound of it, you’re something like a youkai exterminator? Just, one that focuses on restless spirits specifically.
I can understand carrying on the family business. Youkai extermination is the trade of the Hakurei clan for as long as there have been gods in the land.
Ehehe, that makes me happy to hear. I’m glad you think so highly of me.
You’ll have to take the lead on… things. It’ll be fine so long as you’re gentle, but don’t judge me if I’m bad at it.
I’m not disappointed you’re not… out yet, it just seemed odd, is all! Not that I don’t want to see you, it’s just— ugh!
So you’re like a shikigami? A familiar of some powerful sorcerer? This “computer” artifact sounds fearsome indeed if it can let people control you.

For the coin, huh? Sadly, it’s the duty of the Hakurei Shrine maiden to exterminate youkai… meaning I’m always short on coin. Despite all I do, people never show appreciation and donate to the shrine.
Something about you reminds me of an umatsuki, a horse youkai I once exterminated. I don’t show mercy to youkai who try to trick me.
Oh great god of the Hakurei Shrine… I don’t know your name… or what blessings you bestow. But I’m sure they’re very good!
Youkai are youkai. Annoying creatures who act only on selfish desire. They’re the enemy of humans, so I exterminate them whenever they cause trouble.
What, are you saying somebody actually owns a mangy bakeneko like you? You look like a stray! The kitties that hang out at my shrine are much prettier.
Hold on… on closer inspection, I don’t detect any Youkai aura from you. Are you just a sad sack instead?
I’ve always thought religionists have to be something of performers to be successful, but you really go above and beyond. Does being a singing, dancing nun actually bring in worshippers?
So you gave up the shrine maiden life for good? Nice as it must feel to be free, people still gotta eat. What do you do now to make ends meet?

Back home, some dumb youkai tried to bring in hobgoblins to be house\keepers for the human village. But they weren’t cute at all, so the only place that would hire them was the Scarlet Devil Mansion. You’re not one?
Sustainable energy? The gods that live up on Youkai Mountain tried to do that too by feeding a sun god to a Hell Raven. Something called “nuclear fusion”? It was a pain to deal with.
So you’re an animal trainer then? My mentor Kasen is good with animals, she even has a pet raijuu. Oh, that’s like an electric mouse if you can believe it.
That… explained nothing. How can you be both a Blade and not a blade? What even is a Blade?
It’s not like you’re possessed by a vengeful spirit, and it’s not even on the level of a curse. It’s just… misfortune. Sadly, that means there’s no simple ritual to disperse it.
So what you’re saying is, I could make money from playing a children’s card game? That’s so easy! Why do anything else?
I’m not used to sexual stuff either. Gensokyo’s so old fashioned that a game like this would be unheard of, except for youkai. But I never back down!

Being a princess isn’t anything special in Gensokyo. I’ve met a ghost princess, a princess of the moon, an Inchling princess even freeloaded at my shrine before. More importantly, what’re your powers?
According to my witch pal Marisa, people in foreign lands use “ley lines” to transmit magical energy. So I sort of understand. But what are you powering that needs all that energy?
I’m the same, through the blessings of the Hakurei Shrine’s god I’ve indiscriminately fought youkai and gods alike. But I thought angels didn’t care what happened on Earth.
I’d be surprised if a taotie like you really became a protector of humans. Are you saying you’re some kind of youkai exterminator in this Liyue place?

There’s the Agatha Chris Q. mystery series I’m a fan of… and I’ve heard some authors in the outside world sell millions of books! It must take a lot of effort, but I’m sure it’s worth it to please your fans.
A healer? I thought you said you fought with your gauntlets. Not that the doctors in Gensokyo are all that pacifistic either…
Sounds to me like you didn’t know how good you used to have it. I was born into the duty of a Hakurei shrine maiden… so I’m sure having no responsibilities would feel great.
You’re not in it for the money? Seems like a lot of work just to be altruistic about killing people. Though considering how much work I do and how few donations I get, I can hardly talk.
So you’re removing your… well, I suppose all things considered, I can’t really complain.
It’s pretty obvious what you’re hiding. You want to sell me something! Too bad for you, I’m broke!
Your religious devotion, your lack of common sense, your green hair… you’re just like that Moriya Shrine maiden, Sanae!
W-wait, really? You’re not going to respond with some cagey babble or arrogantly threaten me or challenge me to a duel? Things are never this easy back home!
Wait, is that danmaku? What sort of spell card is this?

「夢想天生」
{small}“Fantasy Nature”
~blank~
A gang? No, obviously I mean that you’re a jiang-shi. Even if you’ve used some cheap transformation magic, I can tell from your aura!
I see, Mari… so your fate changed. You know, a lot of people become religious after a near-death experience. Do you visit your local shrine often?
We have bows and stars and umbrellas in Gensokyo too, Leon. When you boil it all down, you’re a youkai exterminator like me, just in your own way!
Of course, it’s not like I could stop resolving incidents in Gensokyo. If left unchecked, who knows what would happen? Nothing good, at least.
If anything, you’d have a hard time stopping my witch friend Marisa from picking a fight with you. She always loves seeing other people’s techniques… and then stealing them.
Oh, your staff broke. You really should take better care of your tools. Otherwise they’ll come back as tsukumogami and haunt you.
It’s so annoying, isn’t it? And their reasons for starting incidents is some self-serving malarky they could have avoided if they gave it more than a seconds’ thought!
Manufacturing a personality seems like too much work. What’s wrong with just being “easy-going girl who likes sake?” You should try it!
I don’t need healing! It doesn’t matter to me what people say! But because of these rumors, people are less inclined to visit my shrine and donate, so we don’t have a lot of money…
If people don’t know who you are, how can they donate to show their appreciation for your deeds? Don’t tell me you do all this work for free? How do you afford sake and snacks?

”My heart belongs to one, but the rest of me belongs to whoever…” what a load of bullpucky.
…A girl I know, Marisa, isn’t serious ever either… and why should she be, she’s got lots of pretty girls after her.
Ugh, why are you trying to be nice about this? You’re a youkai, aren’t you? It’s your duty to prey upon humans!
Good girls on the up-and-up generally don’t use transformation magic. But I’m sure you’re nothing but noble, right?
W-wait… you’re rich because of your youkai extermination? I resolve all the incidents in Gensokyo, but I’m still broke. How do you do it? What’s your business model?
Oh, so your “Tikki” is a divine spirit? I suppose it’s okay to leave it, then. How’d you two meet, anyway?
And you do poetry too? Does that attract worshippers to your shrine? Seems like a pretty good gimmick.
Are you one of those religious types always trying to drag people off to your shrine? We’ve got youkai in Gensokyo who preach about peace and temperance. It’s so hypocritical!
I read in stories that the most evil pirates have big bounties attached to them! What if we teamed up to capture and turn them in to the authorities? Or whoever pays out the big bucks.
Ah, I get how things are with your aunt. A hermit named Kasen is always nagging me to train more or work harder. I can’t have a moment’s peace when she’s around!
How’d you get drafted into a mess like the army? I’m a youkai exterminator so I’m always in fights, but that’s my clan’s duty. Is it like that for you?
I tailored an outfit that makes it easy to dodge attacks from youkai. It’s not armored, but that doesn’t matter in danmaku battles.
Ehe, I’m getting to strip with a real-life detective! Say, Miss Kyoko, is solving mysteries anything like how it works in the novels?
Well, what is a “meaningful” life to you, Meia? Is it not enough to be a devoted shrine maiden and excellent sake brewer?
Wow, so does that mean you already have a betrothed of your own? I, um, already know how I’m finding a lover, but, just for reference, how do you find a lover?

So what you’re saying is, you’re a weak youkai? Thank goodness. I’ve battled an oni who was actually trying before, and I’m not keen on repeating that.
{small}For a number of reasons.
You cat youkai are all the same. Well, I don’t think there are any corpses here for you to steal, but you’re still not allowed to sunbathe on my veranda!
I’m too horny for this.
I’m looking for a ~human.ifMale(husband|wife)~ who can take care of me. Just so I don’t have to do all the work myself, I’m conscripting you to help me find my destined partner!
It’s settled, ~player~! You’re on my side now. And don’t worry, I’ll help you find your own man… just with less effort than I’m using for myself.

It’s decided, let’s work together to find each other a match! Oh, but there aren’t any men at the table, huh? Not sure why you picked this group considering your proclivities, but maybe there’s some guys listening in in secret.
Well, that was fun, at least. Oh, I’m going to watch you strip even if you’re not in the running for marriage material. Hope you don’t mind.
Watching you get naked will help me, at least, for when I nab a husband of my own. I assume so, anyway.
You look good enough, ~player~, so I’m sure some man’s going to want you as his husband. I’m a girl saying this, though, so take it with a grain of salt.
I don’t know if any men have been enjoying the show, but I think you look lovely, ~player~. Probably doesn’t help much coming from another woman, though.
I know my own best qualities, but I don’t know a lot of yours, ~player~. Well, I do like watching you strip. I know you’re not into girls, but I’m allowed to think you’re cute, right?
